commit_message:
Separate nailgun::cobbler from nailgun

Allows isolated deployment of nailgun::cobbler
class without calling nailgun base class for
deployment within Docker.

blueprint fuel-containerization-of-services
Change-Id: Id32f42a31ca17441c75785f6711f86654788a1e3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/61/83061/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $fuel_settings = parseyaml($astute_settings_yaml) $fuel_version = parseyaml($fuel_version_yaml) $production = $::fuel_version['VERSION']['production'] if $production { $env_path = "/usr" $staticdir = "/usr/share/nailgun/static" } else { $env_path = "/opt/nailgun" $staticdir = "/opt/nailgun/share/nailgun/static" } # this replaces removed postgresql version fact $postgres_default_version = '8.4' node default { Exec {path => '/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin'} $centos_repos = [ { "id" => "nailgun", "name" => "Nailgun", "url" => "\$tree" }, ] $cobbler_url = "http://${::fuel_settings['ADMIN_NETWORK']['interface']}/cobbler_api" $cobbler_user = "cobbler" $cobbler_password = "cobbler" $cobbler_host = $::fuel_settings['ADMIN_NETWORK']['interface'] $dhcp_start_address = $::fuel_settings['ADMIN_NETWORK']['dhcp_pool_start'] $dhcp_end_address = $::fuel_settings['ADMIN_NETWORK']['dhcp_pool_end'] $dhcp_netmask = $::fuel_settings['ADMIN_NETWORK']['netmask'] $dhcp_interface = $::fuel_settings['ADMIN_NETWORK']['interface'] $puppet_master_hostname = "${hostname}.${domain}" $mco_pskey = "unset" $mco_vhost = "mcollective" $mco_user = "mcollective" $mco_password = "marionette" $mco_connector = "rabbitmq" $rabbitmq_naily_user = "naily" $rabbitmq_naily_password = "naily" $repo_root = "/var/www/nailgun" $pip_repo = "/var/www/nailgun/eggs" $gem_source = "http://${::fuel_settings['ADMIN_NETWORK']['ipaddress']}:8080/gems/" $ntp_servers = [$::fuel_settings['NTP1'], $::fuel_settings['NTP2'], $::fuel_settings['NTP3']] class { "openstack::clocksync": ntp_servers => $ntp_servers, config_template => "ntp/ntp.conf.centosserver.erb", } class { "nailgun::cobbler": production => $production centos_repos => $centos_repos, gem_source => $gem_source, cobbler_user => $cobbler_user, cobbler_password => $cobbler_password, server => $cobbler_host, name_server => $cobbler_host, next_server => $cobbler_host, dhcp_start_address => $dhcp_start_address, dhcp_end_address => $dhcp_end_address, dhcp_netmask => $dhcp_netmask, dhcp_gateway => $cobbler_host, dhcp_interface => $dhcp_interface, nailgun_api_url => $nailgun_api_url, } }

commit_message:
Fix astute from pkg installation

* Added rabbitmq_host to nailgun::astute class.
* Remove unneeded packages from install

blueprint fuel-containerization-of-services

commit_message:
Add iptables rule parser for docker

Improves iptables firewall filter for
handling addrtype rules.

blueprint fuel-containerization-of-services

added_lines: :addrtype => "-m addrtype --(dst|src)-type", @resource_list = [:table, :source, :destination, :iniface, :outiface, :addrtype, values = values.sub(/(!)\s+-i\s?(\S*)/, '-i \1 \2') values = values.sub(/(!)\s+-o\s?(\S*)/, '-o \1 \2') values = values.sub(/-i (!)\s?(\S*)/, '-i "\1 \2"') values = values.sub(/-o (!)\s?(\S*)/, '-o "\1 \2"')

commit_message:
Add standalone nailgun role puppetsync

This allows the rsync puppet container to
deploy on its own. Additionally, fixed
package and service definitions to allow
xinetd to be defined only in this class.

Change-Id: I599c6eb61eabd64bae1c8c13e93ea4053ca8eaa8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/32/86332/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if !defined(Package['xinetd']) { package { 'xinetd': ensure => installed, } } if ! defined(Service['xinetd']) { service { 'xinetd': ensure => running, enable => true, require => Package['xinetd'], } }}

Fix assertEqual arguments order(catalog, cert_setup, etc)

assertEqual method's arguments should be in
('expected', 'actual') order.

commit_message:
Change errors_out_migration decorator to work with RPC

This decorator in nova/compute/manager.py was written to work with
positional arguments, but at run time the decorated methods are
called via RPC with keyword arguments.  This change fixes the
decorator and the associated test cases.

Closes-Bug: #1300380

Change-Id: I9f87151a71e5217e7eff97cdc5cad2c85b620fa5

commit_message:
VMWare: add power off vm before detach disk during unrescue

Non Hot Plug type disk like IDE can only be detached when the VM is power off.

Change-Id: Ib1f387a41abe2b52357854e90c2535ebb7b43f18
Close-bug: #1279199

deleted_lines: def power_off(self, instance): vm_ref = vm_util.get_vm_ref(self._session, instance)

commit_message:
Fedora does not require openstack-selinux package

Fedora contains SELinux policies to faciliate OpenStack usage in the
policy files shipped in the distribution itself. The additional
openstack-selinux policy provides these policies to RHEL users.

Change-Id: I6ffec6ed9c13ff9754d83eceb16a408eb7a22404
Closes-Bug: #1306352

commit_message:
VMWare: spawn refactor - phase 2 - get_image_properties

Refactors operations around get_image_properties and introduces new vm_config
objects to hold configuration information distilled from the OpenStack Nova
model in a format that will make setting up new vSphere supported features
easier.

This is a first step refactor with just the introduction of vSphere model
objects. This shows a first run at re-wireing the spawn method to leverage
the new class structure.

See also:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/84423/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/81354/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/82957/

partial blueprint vmware-spawn-refactor

Change-Id: I9244d8a47f6cc20107e2bd311dc2de5bb0a18843

commit_message:
Add Scenario meta() to extract meta information from method

Change-Id: Id0db7f78264da5b29f0635c7cbf969f9163d4b03
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/34/86134/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: validators = Scenario.meta(name, "validators") @staticmethod def meta(scenario_name, attr_name): """Extract the named meta information out of the scenario name.""" cls_name, method_name = scenario_name.split(".", 1) cls = Scenario.get_by_name(cls_name) method = getattr(cls, method_name) return getattr(method, attr_name, []) if method else []
deleted_lines: cls_name, method_name = name.split(".", 1) cls = Scenario.get_by_name(cls_name) method = getattr(cls, method_name) validators = getattr(method, "validators", [])

commit_message:
Add opportunity to directly update headers

Added change in request's methods in rest_client
for directly updating headers.
If someone want to add some custom headers to default headers
he can pass variable extra_headers=True in one of
the request's methods(POST/PUT/...) and headers should be
added to default headers

Change-Id: Ifbe49a9f7a6e2de780953ef9dcd39e443d74d151
Closes-bug: 1295661
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/83/82083/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-08 07:45:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a9f114c6d6b5c034895c6ba9ef3b9c2dd05f7faa', 'message': "Fix PortInUse failure for reschedule

When the instance is re-scheduled to another compute node,
the port has already allocated to it. Therefor, when the port's
device_id is equal to instance's uuid, we should not raise
excepiton.PortInUse.

Change-Id: I2f0edd9927db58750f5a3aebf42b7b2d339b2925
Closes-Bug: #1302889
"}]
commit_message:
Fix PortInUse failure for reschedule

When the instance is re-scheduled to another compute node,
the port has already allocated to it. Therefor, when the port's
device_id is equal to instance's uuid, we should not raise
excepiton.PortInUse.

Change-Id: I2f0edd9927db58750f5a3aebf42b7b2d339b2925
Closes-Bug: #1302889
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/46/85946/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/63/85663/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Adding new modules to fuel-library ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *Case A. Pulling in an existing module* If you are adding a module that is the work of another project and is already tracked in separate repo then: 1. Create a review request with a un-modified copy of the upstream module from what ever point you are working from and *no* other related modifications. * This review should also contain the commit hash from the upstream repo in the commit message. * The review should be looked over for reasons for rejecting the entire module (like license, code quality, old version picked...) Forbearing such issues it should be accepted without requiring modifications. 2. Any changes necessary to make it work with Fuel should then be proposed as a dependent change(s). *Case B. Adding a new module* If you are adding a new module that is a work purely for Fuel and will not be tracked in a separate repo then: * Submit either a complete single review (Large commits will delay review) OR * Submit incremental reviews that consist of working implementation of features for your module. If you have features that are necessary, but do not work fully yet, then prevent them from running during the deployment. Once your feature is complete, submit a review to activate the module during deployment.

commit_message:
Fix parsing storage policy in swift.conf

Don't skip next value update in NoOptionError
Raise ValueError if wrong section name found

Change-Id: I711e4d214c415d184df259d62f3847143cae78a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/14/86814/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: policy = {'name': '', 'type': '', 'default': ''} policy['idx'] = int(section_policy[1]) for sec_name in ('name', 'type', 'default'): try: sec_value = conf.get(section, sec_name) except NoOptionError: pass else: policy[sec_name] = sec_value policy['idx'], policy['name'], is_default=config_true_value(policy['default']), policy_type=policy['type']))
deleted_lines: policy_name = '' policy_type = '' is_default = '' policy_idx = int(section_policy[1]) try: policy_name = conf.get(section, 'name') policy_type = conf.get(section, 'type') is_default = conf.get(section, 'default') except NoOptionError: pass policy_idx, policy_name, is_default=config_true_value(is_default), policy_type=policy_type))

commit_message:
Add consoles test for Nova v3 API

This patch adds test for consoles API.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api-tests

Change-Id: Iba2ce2904591e748de008651321fbacdb9f656dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/95/77095/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def list_consoles(self, server_id): """List all consoles for the server.""" resp, body = self.get("servers/%s/consoles" % str(server_id)) body = json.loads(body) return resp, body['consoles'] def get_console(self, server_id, console_id): """Get in-depth information on a specific console.""" resp, body = self.get('servers/%s/consoles/%s' % str(server_id), str(console_id)) body = json.loads(body) return resp, body['consoles'] def create_console(self, server_id, console): """Create a new console.""" post_body = json.dumps({'console': console}) resp, body = self.post('servers/%s/consoles' % str(server_id), post_body) body = json.loads(body) return resp, body['consoles'] def delete_console(self, server_id, console_id): """Deletes a console.""" resp, body = self.delete("servers/%s/consoles/%s" % str(server_id), str(console_id)) return resp, body

commit_message:
Include user/project id when get snapshot/backup

When getting a snapshot/backup/volume, user id and project id should be included,
which is necessary to bill and meter for them.

The fix for this is to include user id when getting a snapshot, user id
and project id when getting a backup.The project id for snapshot and
user/project id for volume have been included in V2 API.

Closes-Bug: #1301861

Change-Id: I2b5d5bfaa8f207467bd54d6f1658e8f62679e7bb

commit_message:
Add configuration for Ceilometer middleware to swift

We should set WARN level by default to avoid syslog flooding.

Closes bug 1294789

Change-Id: I4dfe0bca17135e6526ddbc02cf421b7923b67913

commit_message:
Configure logging for keystone

Define logging configuration in a separate file (potentially adjustable
via heat template variables), set logrotate configuration.

Change-Id: Icb25bdb9ef117c02136d858de879ea3ea9309661

commit_message:
L3 Agent restart causes network outage

When a L3 agent controlling multiple qrouter namespaces
restarts, it destroys all qrouter namespaces even if
some of them are still in use.  As a result, network
traffic could be stopped on the VMs that use the
networks associated with these namespaces.

So what is needed is for the L3 agent to preserve those
qrouter namespaces a L3 agent instance recognizes and to
destroy those it does not know about.

Closes-Bug: #1175695

Change-Id: Idae77886bd195d773878c3d212ccfd56269216fb
(cherry picked from commit 011d99f300ea5d5f4ce48023bd04a795a4872287)

added_lines: self.assertFalse(agent._delete_stale_namespaces) def _cleanup_namespace_test(self, stale_namespace_list, router_list, other_namespaces): self.conf.set_override('router_delete_namespaces', True) good_namespace_list = [l3_agent.NS_PREFIX + r['id'] for r in router_list] self.mock_ip.get_namespaces.return_value = (stale_namespace_list + good_namespace_list + other_namespaces) agent = l3_agent.L3NATAgent(HOSTNAME, self.conf) self.assertTrue(agent._delete_stale_namespaces) pm = self.external_process.return_value pm.reset_mock() agent._destroy_router_namespace = mock.MagicMock() agent._cleanup_namespaces(router_list) self.assertEqual(pm.disable.call_count, len(stale_namespace_list)) self.assertEqual(agent._destroy_router_namespace.call_count, len(stale_namespace_list)) expected_args = [mock.call(ns) for ns in stale_namespace_list] agent._destroy_router_namespace.assert_has_calls(expected_args, any_order=True) self.assertFalse(agent._delete_stale_namespaces) def test_cleanup_namespace(self): self.conf.set_override('router_id', None) stale_namespaces = [l3_agent.NS_PREFIX + 'foo', l3_agent.NS_PREFIX + 'bar'] other_namespaces = ['unknown'] self._cleanup_namespace_test(stale_namespaces, [], other_namespaces) def test_cleanup_namespace_with_registered_router_ids(self): self.conf.set_override('router_id', None) stale_namespaces = [l3_agent.NS_PREFIX + 'cccc', l3_agent.NS_PREFIX + 'eeeee'] router_list = [{'id': 'foo'}, {'id': 'aaaa'}] other_namespaces = ['qdhcp-aabbcc', 'unknown'] self._cleanup_namespace_test(stale_namespaces, router_list, other_namespaces) def test_cleanup_namespace_with_conf_router_id(self): self.conf.set_override('router_id', 'bbbbb') stale_namespaces = [l3_agent.NS_PREFIX + 'cccc', l3_agent.NS_PREFIX + 'eeeee', l3_agent.NS_PREFIX + self.conf.router_id] router_list = [{'id': 'foo'}, {'id': 'aaaa'}] other_namespaces = ['qdhcp-aabbcc', 'unknown'] self._cleanup_namespace_test(stale_namespaces, router_list, other_namespaces)

commit_message:
Add multi role/tenant to user and delete them from user

As administrator/user, a user also has multi role and
tenants, add such case to enhance keystone robustness

Change-Id: I84df22678c0c290fb0c3cc7daac41ad1ac7db563

commit_message:
For ldap, API wrongly reports user is in group

When the ldap identity backend is configured,
HEAD v3/groups/{group_id}/users/{user_id}
always returns 200, even if the user is not actually in the group.
This is because the sql and kvs backend will raise NotFound
exception if the user is not in the group, but the ldap backend
just return result.

Change-Id: Ie1585c8aebe054091bd76fded666bf41125ff9ca
Closes-Bug: 1245247

The tiny amount of sleep in the IOThread loop adds up to more than 2
minutes when transferring a 1.5GB file, and looks totally unnecesary.

Avg time taken to xfer 1.5GB from glance to VC before fix: 250s

Change-Id: I9b156b0b1cf8d493af4d3d30396f5bc6beebebdc

commit_message:
vmwareapi: image transfer unnecessarily slow

The tiny amount of sleep in the IOThread loop adds up to more than 2
minutes when transferring a 1.5GB file, and looks totally unnecesary.

Avg time taken to xfer 1.5GB from glance to VC before fix: 250s
Avg time taken to xfer 1.5GB from glance to VC after fix: 90s

Closes-Bug: #1278690
Change-Id: I9b156b0b1cf8d493af4d3d30396f5bc6beebebdc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/81/75681/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: IO_THREAD_SLEEP_TIME = 0

commit_message:
Allow allocating specific floating ip for admins

bug 1138730

As https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Quantum/APIv2-specification documents: An
address for the floating ip will be automatically allocated, unless the
floating_ip_address attribute is specified in the request body.  If the
requested floating IP address does not fall in the external network's subnet
range, a 400 error will be returned.  If the requested floating IP address
is already in use, a 409 error code will be returned.

Change-Id: I2ea56a4f3a25bfe8110405ef4e9539e42eaa7834

commit_message:
Fix base.CrudManager.put() method.

base.CrudManager.put() method now does allow to pass
body to be sent to the server. Also make put() and update()
methods to follow similar arguments formatting when calling
private method.

Change-Id: Iaa03b20f4b1aa629ccbe9532d47f535ee1abe87d

commit_message:
Refactored nfs_share config file

Added dataset option to nfs_share config file, this option needed to
avoid request for NexentaStor volroot config parameter.

Change-Id: Ic5b0ac46bbedb8c675af70f27b73f62c28a05ac7

commit_message:
host-evacuate should have target_host as positional argument

host-evacuate help shows target host as optional while it's not.
Added target host as positional argument.
To maintain backwards compatibility, the optional argument has
been mantained, but excluded from help.
In the case that both, the postional and the optional target
host arguments are specified, the positional one will be used.
In the case none of them are specified, command error is showed.
Added tests to cover these cases.

Change-Id: I5f52af0972a0ea2105e6178b4e8da00a17e5b691
Closes-Bug: #1278431
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/94/80394/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: @utils.arg('--target_host', metavar='<target_host>', default=None, help=_('Name of target host.'))

commit_message:
Replacing python-oauth2 by oauthlib

This patch replaces the old, unmaintained python-oauth2 library
by the better suited oauthlib in keystone oAuth modules.

The library switch comes with two notable changes in terms of use:

* the client must set the callback uri to 'oob' (out-of-band)
  explicitly when requesting a Request Token
* the requested_project_id header is not included in the signature
  anymore, in compliance with the oAuth1 spec.

Related-Bug: 1240382
Change-Id: Ie553830cc80075aa818e719604e6bc4c754d2ae3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/50/70750/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import oauthlib.common from oauthlib import oauth1 import uuidRequestValidator = oauth1.RequestValidator Client = oauth1.Client AccessTokenEndpoint = oauth1.AccessTokenEndpoint ResourceEndpoint = oauth1.ResourceEndpoint AuthorizationEndpoint = oauth1.AuthorizationEndpoint SIG_HMAC = oauth1.SIGNATURE_HMAC RequestTokenEndpoint = oauth1.RequestTokenEndpoint oRequest = oauthlib.common.Request class Token(object): def __init__(self, key, secret): self.key = key self.secret = secret self.verifier = None def set_verifier(self, verifier): self.verifier = verifierdef token_generator(*args, **kwargs): return uuid.uuid4().hex params = oauth1.rfc5849.utils.parse_authorization_header(auth_header) parameters.update(dict(params)) return parameters def extract_non_oauth_params(query_string): params = oauthlib.common.extract_params(query_string) return dict([(k, v) for k, v in params if not k.startswith('oauth_')])
deleted_lines: import oauth2 as oauthConsumer = oauth.Consumer Request = oauth.Request Server = oauth.Server SignatureMethod = oauth.SignatureMethod SignatureMethod_HMAC_SHA1 = oauth.SignatureMethod_HMAC_SHA1 SignatureMethod_PLAINTEXT = oauth.SignatureMethod_PLAINTEXT Token = oauth.Token Client = oauth.Client # Check that the authorization header is OAuth. if auth_header[:6] == 'OAuth ': auth_header = auth_header[6:] # Get the parameters from the header. header_params = oauth.Request._split_header(auth_header) parameters.update(header_params) return parameters

commit_message:
VMware - spawn refactor - model example

Do not commit.

This is an example of a domain model that can be used to build
up a valid set of commands to be sent to vSphere. The new classes
have all the properties that the spawn method uses for decision
making and includes a set of validations for assignment of values
used directly in vsphere commands.

partial blueprint vmware-spawn-refactor

Change-Id: I7733394fa195fd0655e37e640ffcd001ab7f40a5

class VirtualMachineTestCase(test.NoDBTestCase): def setUp(self): super(VirtualMachineTestCase, self).setUp() def tearDown(self): super(VirtualMachineTestCase, self).tearDown() def test_validate_value_positive(self): self.assertTrue(model.validate_value(['foo', 'bar'], 'bar')) def test_validate_value_negative(self): self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidParameterValue, model.validate_value, ['foo', 'bar'], 'baz') def test_validate_value_none_positive(self): self.assertTrue(model.validate_value([None, 'foo'], None)) def test_validate_value_none_negative(self): self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidParameterValue, model.validate_value, ['foo', 'bar'], None) def test_vm_config_builder_simple(self): instance = {'uuid': 'fake_uuid', 'root_gb': 100} meta_data = {'size': 100 * units.Gi, 'disk_format': 'vmdk', 'properties': { "vmware_ostype": "bsd", "vmware_adaptertype": 'ide', "vmware_disktype": 'thick', "hw_vif_model": 'foobar', model.VMWARE_LINKED_CLONE_PROPERTY: True}} vm_config = model.config_builder(instance, meta_data) self.assertIsNotNone(vm_config) class SizeMixinTestCase(testtools.TestCase): def check_sizes(self, size, size_in_bytes, size_in_kb, size_in_mb, size_in_gb): self.assertEqual(size_in_gb, size.size_in_gb) self.assertEqual(size_in_mb, size.size_in_mb) self.assertEqual(size_in_kb, size.size_in_kb) self.assertEqual(size_in_bytes, size.size) def calculate_sizes(self, gb): size_in_gb = gb size_in_mb = gb * units.Ki size_in_kb = gb * units.Mi size_in_bytes = gb * units.Gi return size_in_bytes, size_in_kb, size_in_mb, size_in_gb def check_size_setter(self, method, gb): size_object = model.SizeMixin() (size_in_bytes, size_in_kb, size_in_mb, size_in_gb) = self.calculate_sizes(gb) method(size_object) self.check_sizes(size_object, size_in_bytes, size_in_kb, size_in_mb, size_in_gb) def test_set_size(self): # set 8 Gb in bytes on vm, validate other size data def setter(size): size.size = 1 * units.Gi self.check_size_setter(setter, 1) def test_set_size_in_kb(self): def setter(size): size.size_in_kb = 8 * units.Mi self.check_size_setter(setter, 8) def test_set_size_in_mb(self): def setter(size): size.size_in_mb = 8 * units.Ki self.check_size_setter(setter, 8) def test_set_size_in_gb(self): def setter(size): size.size_in_gb = units.Gi self.check_size_setter(setter, units.Gi) def test_set_size_in_gb_fractional(self): def setter(size): size.size_in_gb = units.Gi / 3 # NOTE: 1/3 is used here because 1/3 cannot be accurately # represented in binary so this represents a good edge case self.check_size_setter(setter, units.Gi / 3) class VirtualDiskTestCase(test.TestCase): def test_bad_adapter(self): vd = model.VirtualDiskProperties() def set(vd, value): # we need to create a method here because we can't call # on the property setter directly vd.adapter_type = value self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidParameterValue, set, vd, 'bad') def test_bad_disk_type(self): vd = model.VirtualDiskProperties() def set(vd, value): # we can't set a property through assertRaises so # we have to create a method to do that. vd.disk_type = value self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidParameterValue, set, vd, 'bad') def test_allow_none_values(self): vd = model.VirtualDiskProperties() vd.adapter_type = None self.assertIsNone(vd.adapter_type) vd.disk_type = None self.assertIsNone(vd.disk_type) def test_linked_clone_override(self): self.flags(use_linked_clone=True, group='vmware') vd = model.VirtualDiskProperties() # asserts the default linked_clone mode is 'True' or 'On' self.assertTrue(vd.linked_clone) # asserts that we can override the default mode vd2 = model._build_root_disk({'size': 1}, { "vmware_ostype": "freebsdGuest", "vmware_adaptertype": 'ide', "vmware_disktype": 'thick', "hw_vif_model": 'VirtualE1000', model.VMWARE_LINKED_CLONE_PROPERTY: False}) self.assertFalse(vd2.linked_clone) def test_linked_clone_config_pass_thru(self): self.flags(use_linked_clone=False, group='vmware') vd = model.VirtualDiskProperties() self.assertFalse(vd.linked_clone) def test_is_iso(self): vd = model.VirtualDiskProperties() vd.disk_format = 'iso' self.assertTrue(vd.is_iso) self.assertTrue(vd.is_file) self.assertFalse(vd.is_vmdk) def test_is_vmdk(self): vd = model.VirtualDiskProperties() vd.disk_format = 'vmdk' self.assertFalse(vd.is_iso) self.assertTrue(vd.is_file) self.assertTrue(vd.is_vmdk) def test_is_not_a_file(self): vd = model.VirtualDiskProperties() vd.disk_format = None self.assertFalse(vd.is_iso) self.assertFalse(vd.is_file) self.assertFalse(vd.is_vmdk) class RootDiskTestCase(VirtualDiskTestCase): def test_root_disk(self): root_disk = model.RootDiskProperties() root_disk.ds('fake_ref', 'ds21') root_disk.instance_uuid = 'fake_uuid' self.assertEqual('[ds21] fake_uuid/fake_uuid.vmdk', root_disk.datastore_path) def test_root_disk_sparse(self): root_disk = model.RootDiskProperties() root_disk.ds('fake_ref', 'ds21') root_disk.instance_uuid = 'fake_uuid' self.assertEqual('[ds21] fake_uuid/fake_uuid-sparse.vmdk', root_disk.datastore_path_sparse) self.assertEqual('[ds21] fake_uuid/fake_uuid-flat.vmdk', root_disk.datastore_path_flat) class VirtualMachinePropertiesMixinTextCase(test.TestCase): def test_os_type(self): vm_props = model.VirtualMachinePropertiesMixin() vm_props.os_type = 'dosGuest' self.assertEqual('dosGuest', vm_props.os_type) def test_os_type_bad(self): vm_props = model.VirtualMachinePropertiesMixin() def bad_setter(vm_props, value): vm_props.os_type = value self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidParameterValue, bad_setter, vm_props, 'badValue') class VirtualMachineInstanceConfigTestCase(test.TestCase): def test_image_disk_size_in_gb(self): vm = model.VirtualMachineInstanceConfig() vm.root_disk = model.RootDiskProperties() vm.root_disk.size = 13 * units.Gi self.assertEqual(13, vm.image_disk_size_in_gb) return vm def test_needs_resize(self): vm = self.test_image_disk_size_in_gb() vm.root_gb = 20 self.assertTrue(vm.image_is_valid) self.assertTrue(vm.root_needs_resize) def test_no_resize_possible(self): vm = self.test_image_disk_size_in_gb() vm.root_gb = 10 self.assertFalse(vm.image_is_valid) self.assertFalse(vm.root_needs_resize) def test_ebs_root(self): vm = model.VirtualMachineInstanceConfig() self.assertFalse(vm.ebs_root) vm.block_device_mapping = mock.Mock() self.assertTrue(vm.ebs_root) def test_builder(self): #instance, image_meta, injected_files, # admin_password, network_info, block_device_info= fake_instance = {'uuid': 'fake_uuid', 'root_gb': 101} image_meta_data = {'size': 100 * units.Gi, 'disk_format': 'vmdk', 'properties': { "vmware_ostype": "freebsdGuest", "vmware_adaptertype": 'ide', "vmware_disktype": 'thick', "hw_vif_model": 'VirtualE1000', "use_linked_clone": True}} injected_files = ['file1', 'file2'] admin_password = 'example_password' network_info = [{'id': 'fake_network_uuid', 'type': 'bridge', 'address': '127.0.0.1'}] block_device_info = None vm_config = model.config_builder( fake_instance, image_meta_data, injected_files, admin_password, network_info, block_device_info ) self.assertIsNotNone(vm_config) self.assertFalse(vm_config.ebs_root) self.assertEqual('fake_uuid', vm_config.name) self.assertEqual(101, vm_config.root_gb) megabytes = 101 * units.Ki self.assertEqual(megabytes, vm_config.root_size_in_mb) self.assertTrue(vm_config.root_needs_resize) self.assertEqual('ide', vm_config.root_disk.adapter_type) self.assertTrue(vm_config.root_disk.linked_clone)

commit_message:
add deprecate warning for nova.virt.libvirt.vif.LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver

nova.virt.libvirt.vif.LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver does not exist in
Icehouse, and configurations using this setting for vif_driver will fail
to start.

This patch against Havana emits a deprecation message at WARN priority.

Change-Id: I2d44d33fe2424b4a84ed40e8d43670b899ddc009
Closes-bug: 1302796
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/63/85463/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Detect baremetal undercloud and change heat.

The invocation of heat when setting up the undercloud host assumes that said
host will run on Virtualised hardware. This script detects whether the first
node is baremetal using it's "pm_type" and switches the heat template and
variables to match

Change-Id: Ifff5600963e9cf61730d2f57984a79dd5547143c

commit_message:
Enforce capitalization of cfg help strings

oslo.config has now a style guide that recommends capitalization
of help strings. Nova has a check for this (see change
I0a1c333bbb3a812932d3972a7403f94da0bff341), move it over to
hacking so that other projects get checked as well.

Change-Id: I3c7bf335e1ccb6a2c814d8af228663530a74be14
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/hacking refs/changes/93/74493/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CFG_RE = re.compile(r".*\scfg\.") @flake8ext def capital_cfg_help(logical_line, tokens): r"""Capitalize cfg help strings. Okay: cfg.BoolOpt('api_rate_limit', default=False, help="W...") H905: cfg.BoolOpt('api_rate_limit', default=False, help="w...") """ msg = "H905: capitalize help string" if CFG_RE.match(logical_line): for t in range(len(tokens)): if tokens[t][1] == "help": txt = tokens[t + 2][1] if len(txt) > 1 and txt[1].islower(): yield(0, msg)

commit_message:
Test out using lazy translation

Proof of Concept: DO NOT MERGE

We only want to take the translation performance hit if we are actually
using the string.

Additionally we can drop translation for debug logs as per:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards#Log_Translation

Change-Id: I881bf911ee87c13c973ec9d505ab3a929075b212

added_lines: @staticmethod def best_match_language(accept_language): """Determines best available locale from the Accept-Language header. :returns: the best language match or None if the 'Accept-Language' header was not available in the request. """ if not accept_language: return None all_languages = gettextutils.get_available_languages('ironic') return accept_language.best_match(all_languages) user_locale = self.best_match_language(req.accept_language) try: fault = json.loads('\n'.join(app_iter)) if error is not None and 'faultstring' in fault: fault['faultstring'] = gettextutils.translate(( error, user_locale)) body = [json.dumps({'error_message': fault})] except ValueError: body = [json.dumps({'error_message': '\n'.join(app_iter)})] state['headers'].append(('Content-Type', 'application/json'))

commit_message:
Treat LDAP attribute names as case-insensitive

LDAP attribute names are case-insensitive, and different LDAP
server implementations behave differently when returning search
results.  Keystone attempts to use the attribute names as defined
in the mapping configuration when checking for values in the dict
that represents the search results.  If the case doesn't match,
we won't find the values which can lead to errors.

This patch converts the dictionary keys to lowercase to allow us
to perform a case-insensitive lookup when processing LDAP search
results.  When we create the model object, we still use the
attribute name case as defined in the mapping to allow predictable
lookups when we process the model object later.

Change-Id: Ib9a03b912bc7652dc6a61b1c97a950e263a9c6fa
Closes-bug: 1281216
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/86/86486/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Statistics groupby handling improvement

The groupby parameter for statistics now handle single string as a
parameter. It fixes the bug where every characters of the string where
interpreted as a groupby value.

Change-Id: Ia763741d7ad5717be381b0ac2f0acb57e9f46cac
Closes-Bug: #1291935
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ceilometerclient refs/changes/56/80256/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if isinstance(str, groupby): groupby = [groupby]

commit_message:
Fix missing import of rbd_user

rbd_user is defined in nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py, but it is also
used in nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py, and it is not
imported to this module.

Closes-bug: #1304762

Change-Id: Ied7439a6293b86935ad01eb0642fd3b99d9ebb64
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/08/86208/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Finish _delete_instance() object conversion

The _delete_instance() helper has been using objects for a while
now, but was still using an old conductor method to actually
destroy the instance. This makes it use instance.destroy(). Since the
same thing happens under the covers, none of the tests need to be
changed.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: I413394bbc931d1011c276454ecb34ddd8d948f07

Make detach_volume() use objects

objects.

Convert test_backend_ldap to config fixture

The test_backend_ldap module wasn't using the config fixture for
setting config options.

commit_message:
Remove unused create_image of Nova v2 API

There are two create_image methods for Nova v2 API, but the one of
images_client.py only is used in most cases.
This patch removes the unused create_image of servers_client.py.

Change-Id: Icd457b6693c076c5c8b9d48bb88da162161c9a1a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/49/83649/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def create_image(self, server_id, name): """Creates an image of the given server.""" return self.action(server_id, 'createImage', None, name=name)

commit_message:
Adds style checks to ease reviewer burden

The following checks were added in this commit:

 - mutable default args are no longer allowed
 - block comments must begin with at least one space
 - enforce assertIsNone instead of assertEqual with a None

bp more-code-style-automation

Change-Id: I7dba0c8b45078a665d40993d751c79566aa7505f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/19/78119/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [hacking] local-check-factory = keystone.hacking.checks.factory

subject: Work around atexit bug in python < 2.7.4
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-31 20:50:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/c43208b1a26eaf267646b8c2ae6c3f75b4fc6eb7', 'message': 'Work around atexit bug in python < 2.7.4

In python < 2.7.4, a lazy loading of package `pbr` will break
setuptools if some other modules registered functions in `atexit`.

commit_message:
Work around atexit bug in python < 2.7.4

In python < 2.7.4, a lazy loading of package `pbr` will break
setuptools if some other modules registered functions in `atexit`.
solution from: http://bugs.python.org/issue15881#msg170215

This problem originally appeared in stevedore before the library
was adopted by Oslo
(https://github.com/dreamhost/stevedore/commit/74a719b11781cc93d60cff1b0a01de3e4e780a1d)

Change-Id: Icd412ca8435dca4b0f3b4075eca39b903dde6d27
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/45/84245/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # In python < 2.7.4, a lazy loading of package `pbr` will break # setuptools if some other modules registered functions in `atexit`. # solution from: http://bugs.python.org/issue15881#msg170215 try: import multiprocessing # flake8: noqa except ImportError: pass

commit_message:
Fixes Glance Registry V2 client

Add an optional configuration step to glance.db.get_api().

This step is then used in glance.db.registry.api in order to ensure that
the registry client has been configured in time for the registry db
driver's use.

Closes bug: #1302345

Change-Id: Id2c52c423b411ec20bdfa76ee91837c98b1613ef
Co-Authored-By: Mark J. Washenberger <mark.washenberger@markwash.net>

commit_message:
Update Glance configuration sample files for database options

Sample configuration files are out of date with respect to database
options. This change makes the options up-to-date.

Closes-bug: #1285617
Change-Id: I2694425a0b1610f37e77f1bc81aebed850a16348
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Add headers to DirectClientException

DirectClientException is a subclass of ClientException with a convience
constructor.  ClientException now supports an http_headers kwarg.

Exceptions raised from direct_client will include headers.

Change-Id: Ie4aae55b3e00cf2ac05eb1a920893398f87030c2

commit_message:
Remove call to depmod in busybox

The version of depmod in busybox does not work if two versions of
the same kernel version are available, as search paths are not
honoured correctly.  However, we don't need to actually call
depmod as it's done during image building anyway.

Change-Id: Idd3cd5854e7c86e7ca1f2b0e50758d7db79ab6e7
Co-Author: matthew.gilliard@hp.com
Closes-bug: #1302856

commit_message:
Remove usage of Glance from PXE clean_up()

Save uuids of instance kernel and ramdisk from Glance into node driver_info
('pxe_kernel' and 'pxe_ramdisk'). Stored values used in PXE clean_up()
method.

Closes-Bug: #1300602
Change-Id: I59b3dbd4f66c59060e5b229eae00b80fdc4702e5

commit_message:
Process provider templates for included files

Currently a provider template in the environment or template will not be processed
for other provider templates or calls to get_file.

This change calls get_template_contents from within get_file_contents if the
get_file_contents call is flagged as being for loading a template. This results in
recursive calls to get_file_contents for any combination of provider paths or get_file
calls.

This means many of the template_utils tests need to return valid template content
instead of less meaningful stubs when resolving resource provider paths.

Change-Id: I887b1238d7f7cd67719d54cbc702bbc982552db8
Closes-Bug: #1296950

commit_message:
Add qa-specs to tracked projects

qa specs covers design specification proposals for all the projects
in the qa program. (which currently is grenade and tempest) So we
should track the reviews separately.

Change-Id: I77422da55b84b90fbf6c305a009bedd724453380

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-11 17:55:10.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/service/edp/binary_retrievers/internal_swift.py', 'sahara/swift/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara/commit/ae7df7ce6d80eb24b2904bcd4f0bddf14e042c18', 'message': "Fix storing binaries in Swift

 * Swift does not work with Keystone API v3, so we need to always provide

 * We incorrectly parsed swift URL, which resulted in Sahara trying
   to get binaries from containers with '.sahara' suffix, while the
   suffix should be stripped.

Closes-Bug: #1305210

(cherry picked from commit 9ad556f5984510b843b2b52c127af2fa804d98cf)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix storing binaries in Swift

 * Swift does not work with Keystone API v3, so we need to always provide
   auth_url for API v2 to Swift.
 * We incorrectly parsed swift URL, which resulted in Sahara trying
   to get binaries from containers with '.sahara' suffix, while the
   suffix should be stripped.

Closes-Bug: #1305210
Change-Id: I76dee756165e089bc408e584f3aa476c45ed6067
(cherry picked from commit 9ad556f5984510b843b2b52c127af2fa804d98cf)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/80/86980/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: SWIFT_URL_SUFFIX = '.sahara'

commit_message:
Refactor: moved flatten function to utils

Previously, the keystone.common.authorization module contained the function
"flatten", which would transform a dictionary (possibly nested) into a
single level dictionary. Given that the "flattening" of a dictionary is
a more general concept, not related to authorization, I thought it would
be more intuitive to have it in the keystone.common.utils module.

Change-Id: Ic1f6fa70634ade41e392ee7c5cd8adac913fd0b8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/21/85721/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import collectionsdef flatten_dict(d, parent_key=''): """Flatten a nested dictionary Converts a dictionary with nested values to a single level flat dictionary, with dotted notation for each key. """ items = [] for k, v in d.items(): new_key = parent_key + '.' + k if parent_key else k if isinstance(v, collections.MutableMapping): items.extend(flatten_dict(v, new_key).items()) else: items.append((new_key, v)) return dict(items)

commit_message:
Fixed vpnaas agent for RedHat systems

The package vpnaas package was not installed by default for RedHat
systems, and the service had the incorrect name. This patch
installs the package and sets the correct service name.

Backport to stable/havana

Change-Id: Id54dfbcb918d7d9ba110eb238858162c5cc0380e
(cherry picked from commit f3f723277d5c73d46890ce6872fbeeb11a5c2797)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/75/86675/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $vpnaas_agent_package = 'openstack-neutron-vpn-agent' $vpnaas_agent_service = 'neutron-vpn-agent'

commit_message:
Standardise manifest creation and retrieval

* Create a standard element to copy manifests out of the image and
  into the build area.
* Ensure all current manifests are copied into a standard manifests
  directory

Change-Id: I37eff5a13a14564e1adc33eb4f0144d571267617

commit_message:
Reduce size of log tarball's

The binary systemd logs files don't zip well, compressing with xz at a
compression level of 3 matches the speed of compressing with gzip but
halfs the space used. Also filtering out /etc/services and /etc/pki as
these tend to take up a lot of space. This reduces the Fedora tarballs
from 2MB to about 700KB.

Change-Id: Id0d5d3b9587d2739bf9197f8b3a13549df00ae6f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/50/86550/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "( set -x ; ps -ef ; df -h ; uptime ; sudo netstat -lpn ; sudo iptables-save ; sudo ovs-vsctl show ; ip addr ; dpkg -l || rpm -qa) 2>&1 | sudo dd of=/var/log/host_info.txt &> /dev/null ; sudo XZ_OPT=-3 tar -cJf - --exclude=udev/hwdb.bin --exclude=selinux/targeted --exclude=etc/services --exclude=etc/pki /var/log /etc || true" > $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.xz
deleted_lines: "( set -x ; ps -ef ; df -h ; uptime ; sudo netstat -lpn ; sudo iptables-save ; sudo ovs-vsctl show ; ip addr ; dpkg -l || rpm -qa) 2>&1 | sudo dd of=/var/log/host_info.txt &> /dev/null ; sudo tar -czf - --exclude=udev/hwdb.bin --exclude=selinux/targeted /var/log /etc || true" > $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tgz

commit_message:
Fix network-api direct database hits in metadata server

The metadata server was using a couple of methods from the network
api that caused direct-to-database accesses. Those are no longer
necessary with the object modeling of network resources. This patch
converts those to use objects and avoid the direct database
traffic.

Change-Id: Iea48f74387afa35af3889eebdfa1af169a52ad1d
Closes-bug: #1306009

commit_message:
Make tripleo-cd's te_localrc to support controller

Updates the te_localrc config file within tripleo-cd so
that it supports 'notCompute' or 'controller'.

We are moving towards using 'controller' exclusively...

Change-Id: I457ce4466af2998a11020bfec623a6bf113128a1

commit_message:
Move dnsmasq-neutron.conf into subdir

If you try to use a custom Neutron dnsmasq conf file today many
of the Neutron servers will fail to start with the following
error messages:

oslo.config.cfg.ConfigFileParseError: Failed to parse
/etc/neutron/dnsmasq-neutron.conf: at
/etc/neutron/dnsmasq-neutron.conf:1, Section must be started before
assignment: None

In this patch we move the custom dnsmasq-neutron.conf into
a 'dnsmasq' subdirectory so that the --config-dir options
for our neutron services no longer pick it up by default.

Change-Id: I120fad69a068811403a460507b6b0769e764742f
Closes-bug: #1305254
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/24/86424/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: dnsmasq_config_file=/etc/neutron/dnsmasq/dnsmasq-neutron.conf

commit_message:
Replace assert statements with assert methods

Some of the test methods were using python assert
statements for making assertions. This patch replaces
those statements with apropriate assert methods.

Change-Id: I3fcf4253560474868a0b32a7994f446e7b4bcc67
Closes-bug: #1303124

commit_message:
Use the domain filter provided by keystoneclient

The keystone api client in horizon has it's own filter
by domain implementation for group listing. Switch
this over to use the keystoneclient domain filter for
a cleaner implementation.

Change-Id: Ie47b27ddc8bcaa9b9f22c5925580b8889a65c1d0
Closes-Bug: #1306213
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/21/86821/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: groups = manager.list(user=user, domain=domain)
deleted_lines: groups = manager.list(user=user) # TODO(dklyle): once keystoneclient supports filtering by # domain change this to use that cleaner implementation if domain: domain_groups = [] for group in groups: if group.domain_id == domain: domain_groups.append(group) groups = domain_groups

commit_message:
WIP: Add mysql/mariadb cluster support

Allows joining multiple nodes into mysql cluster. Init process is
tricky because first node has to be started standalone, then once
cluster is created, then this node should rejoin to the existing
cluster on the next restart. And recognize if cluster was already
created is not trivial - additional wsrep notification script is used
for watching cluster changes.

This is based on Greg's clustering patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/83675/

I send this out as POC for now, some minor cleanup would be required.

Change-Id: I8fa2dd18950bf3dff7548270ade8cdb08743610e

commit_message:
Allow baremetal-networks to be passed to devtest

Previously change I6e89dc98 allowed custom baremetal networks to be
configured in testenv.json.
This change allows you to pass in those custom entries as a json
file.

Change-Id: Iad5eb781fa236e71a40245d893f8f0b632b5c370

New command with timesync - setup.sh install tymesync.
Old syntax - setup.sh install works too.

commit_message:
Fix storing binaries in Swift

 * Swift does not work with Keystone API v3, so we need to always provide
   auth_url for API v2 to Swift.
 * We incorrectly parsed swift URL, which resulted in Sahara trying
   to get binaries from containers with '.sahara' suffix, while the
   suffix should be stripped.

Closes-Bug: #1305210
Change-Id: I76dee756165e089bc408e584f3aa476c45ed6067

subject: Fix Nova rescheduling tear down problem
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-10 21:46:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/8befd9d948831ce82c451e774da272649402e27c', 'message': "Fix Nova rescheduling tear down problem

If something fails in the spawn() method (e.g driver parameters, node
in maintenance mode) nova will try to rescheduler the instance (in case
the retry filter is enabled) as part of the rescheduling process nova
will call destroy() on that instance which was cause another problem
when Ironic tried to undeploy a node that wasn't deployed. This patch
is fixing the tear down problem by checking the provision_state of the
node before requesting Ironic to undeploy the node.

Also, the relevant code and tests underwent some refactoring to make
the code shorter and less nested.

Change-Id: Ic3a502167103e84be041ca1ee06fd17d8140529c
Closes-Bug: #1300288
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-11 00:24:17.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'ironic/nova/virt/ironic/ironic_states.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/80e26634af4d9e0ab943abe06583c4c1d0466c65', 'message': "Fix Nova rescheduling tear down problem

commit_message:
Fix Nova rescheduling tear down problem

If something fails in the spawn() method (e.g driver parameters, node
in maintenance mode) nova will try to rescheduler the instance (in case
the retry filter is enabled) as part of the rescheduling process nova
will call destroy() on that instance which was cause another problem
when Ironic tried to undeploy a node that wasn't deployed. This patch
is fixing the tear down problem by checking the provision_state of the
node before requesting Ironic to undeploy the node.

Cherry picked from 1b1d6b0cec64311ae62443b8647fd528d3c91f1d

Change-Id: Ic3a502167103e84be041ca1ee06fd17d8140529c
Closes-Bug: #1300288

commit_message:
Fixes Glance Registry V2 client

Add an optional configuration step to glance.db.get_api().

This step is then used in glance.db.registry.api in order to ensure that
the registry client has been configured in time for the registry db
driver's use.

Closes bug: #1302345

Change-Id: I297e281d096342440208122439fbdacd63c6ce0a
Co-Authored-By: Mark J. Washenberger <mark.washenberger@markwash.net>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/54/86954/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def configure(): api.configure_registry_client()

commit_message:
Update Glance configuration sample files for database options

Sample configuration files are out of date with respect to database
options. This change makes the options up-to-date.

Change-Id: I6935ae3343ace6684439ee005402819039cb19cf
Closes-bug: #1285617
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/53/86953/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #data_api = glance.db.sqlalchemy.api# ================= Database Options ========================== [database] # The file name to use with SQLite (string value) #sqlite_db = glance.sqlite # If True, SQLite uses synchronous mode (boolean value) #sqlite_synchronous = True # The backend to use for db (string value) # Deprecated group/name - [DEFAULT]/db_backend #backend = sqlalchemy # The SQLAlchemy connection string used to connect to the # database (string value) # Deprecated group/name - [DEFAULT]/sql_connection # Deprecated group/name - [DATABASE]/sql_connection # Deprecated group/name - [sql]/connection #connection = <None> # The SQL mode to be used for MySQL sessions. This option, # including the default, overrides any server-set SQL mode. To # use whatever SQL mode is set by the server configuration, # set this to no value. Example: mysql_sql_mode= (string # value) #mysql_sql_mode = TRADITIONAL # Timeout before idle sql connections are reaped (integer # value) # Deprecated group/name - [DEFAULT]/sql_idle_timeout # Deprecated group/name - [DATABASE]/sql_idle_timeout # Deprecated group/name - [sql]/idle_timeout #idle_timeout = 3600 # Minimum number of SQL connections to keep open in a pool # (integer value) # Deprecated group/name - [DEFAULT]/sql_min_pool_size # Deprecated group/name - [DATABASE]/sql_min_pool_size #min_pool_size = 1 # Maximum number of SQL connections to keep open in a pool # (integer value) # Deprecated group/name - [DEFAULT]/sql_max_pool_size # Deprecated group/name - [DATABASE]/sql_max_pool_size #max_pool_size = <None> # Maximum db connection retries during startup. (setting -1 # implies an infinite retry count) (integer value) # Deprecated group/name - [DEFAULT]/sql_max_retries # Deprecated group/name - [DATABASE]/sql_max_retries #max_retries = 10 # Interval between retries of opening a sql connection # (integer value) # Deprecated group/name - [DEFAULT]/sql_retry_interval # Deprecated group/name - [DATABASE]/reconnect_interval #retry_interval = 10 # If set, use this value for max_overflow with sqlalchemy # (integer value) # Deprecated group/name - [DEFAULT]/sql_max_overflow # Deprecated group/name - [DATABASE]/sqlalchemy_max_overflow #max_overflow = <None> # Verbosity of SQL debugging information. 0=None, # 100=Everything (integer value) # Deprecated group/name - [DEFAULT]/sql_connection_debug #connection_debug = 0 # Add python stack traces to SQL as comment strings (boolean # value) # Deprecated group/name - [DEFAULT]/sql_connection_trace #connection_trace = False # If set, use this value for pool_timeout with sqlalchemy # (integer value) # Deprecated group/name - [DATABASE]/sqlalchemy_pool_timeout #pool_timeout = <None> # Enable the experimental use of database reconnect on # connection lost (boolean value) #use_db_reconnect = False # seconds between db connection retries (integer value) #db_retry_interval = 1 # Whether to increase interval between db connection retries, # up to db_max_retry_interval (boolean value) #db_inc_retry_interval = True # max seconds between db connection retries, if # db_inc_retry_interval is enabled (integer value) #db_max_retry_interval = 10 # maximum db connection retries before error is raised. # (setting -1 implies an infinite retry count) (integer value) #db_max_retries = 20

Any valid SQLAlchemy connection string is fine. # See: http://www.sqlalchemy.org/docs/05/reference/sqlalchemy/connections.html#sqlalchemy.create_engine sql_connection = sqlite:///glance.sqlite # Period in seconds after which SQLAlchemy should reestablish its connection # to the database. # # MySQL uses a default `wait_timeout` of 8 hours, after which it will drop # idle connections. This can result in 'MySQL Gone Away' exceptions. If you # notice this, you can lower this value to ensure that SQLAlchemy reconnects # before MySQL can drop the connection. sql_idle_timeout = 3600

commit_message:
Do not sync power state for new invalidated nodes

sync_power_state periodic task puts node in maintenance mode after max
sync retries. If node created and has unknown power state this
periodic task set maintenance mode too fast (there is not yet IPMI
credentials for example).
This patch prevent sync_power_state for these nodes if validate fail.

Closes-Bug: #1304642
Change-Id: I19798028adce91b107643f5419999389dafdccf3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/29/86529/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if node.power_state is None: try: task.driver.power.validate(task, node) except exception.InvalidParameterValue: return

commit_message:
Blueprint for migrating console logs

This is a proposed blueprint to migrate console logs during a vm
live-migration using a libvirt driver.

Implements: blueprint support-console-log-migration

Change-Id: If3f628db677c738688f6a5dceae25827e9a91564
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/66/84766/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================================== Support Console Log migration during Live-migration =================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/support-console-log-migration Implement console log migration during live-migration in the libvirt driver Problem description =================== Currently, in libvirt driver with a kvm hypervisor, console output is written to console.log. Nova responds to a get-console-log request with the contents of this file and this information is useful for debugging issues during boot process. However, during a live-migration the contents of the file in the source node is discarded. There are two issues which play a role in this. * The new kvm process in the destination would have already started using an empty console log. * While the migration progresses the VM in the source node will continue to write to the console log. Proposed change =============== We propose the following in this blueprint to solve this issue without depending on kvm. * Require that VIR_MIGRATE_UNDEFINE_SOURCE is not set. Instead wait for the condition that the instance is shutoff at the source. * During post-live-migration copy the console log be from source node and save in the destination node as console.log.1. If log rotation is implemented, all the rotated files need to be rotated once. * Change get-console-log function such that console.log and console.log.1 are merged in the response (within the MAX_CONSOLE_BYTES limit). It log rotation is implemented then the function needs to read as many files as it takes to fill up the MAX_CONSOLE_BYTES limit. * The source VM would get undefined by the periodic task once the database is updated with the new hostname. Alternatives ------------ * It's perhaps possible to change qemu to move the opened files of an instance during migration. * It's possible to write console output to a remote location so that one doesn't need to worry about migrating it. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ * There's a brief window between the time the VM is activated in the destination and before post-live-migration is completed. Any nova console-log requests will return almost empty content during this window. Other deployer impact --------------------- * If people are using VIR_MIGRATE_UNDEFINE_SOURCE then they need to remove this option to get this feature. If this flag exists we will fallback to not having the console log migrated. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: parthipan Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Change live-migration to wait for shutoff state if flag VIR_MIGRATE_UNDEFINE_SOURCE is not set. * Change get_console_log to handle rotated log files * Implement console log migration during post-live-migration Dependencies ============ * There could be some implications for this design due to this proposed bp as it evolves. At the moment I don't see major incompatibilities but that maybe because of my lack of understanding of this proposal. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/80865/3/specs/juno/libvirt-serial-console Testing ======= Tempest tests should be added to test that the console logs are merged in the response and catch other corner-cases. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== * https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1203193

commit_message:
Implement version 2 payload with more hw info

Bumping the payload version to two, and adding CPU, Memory, and Block
Device information to the inventory.

Added dependency on psutil for available memory and cpu_count.
Requirements line copied from global requirements

Change-Id: Ia39c85c91b1d60468667787a7978020084dc6c2a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/75/86475/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: payload_version = '2'

commit_message:
Fix for enormous progress bar rising of deployment task

Weight for node deletion subtask of deployment supertask in
ApplyChangesTaskManager added. New integration tests added. Some
refactoring to TaskHelper performed: formula that calculate progress for
supertask has been moved to separate class method.

Change-Id: I2143f9999320c66b49940844d5b1b7a7f5e2a77c
Closes-Bug: #1286124
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/42/86342/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # For more accurate progress calculation task_deletion.weight = 0.4 db().add(task_deletion) db().commit()

commit_message:
Add haproxy reload workaround

Increase sleep time and retries amount
Also grep for netns

Change-Id: I247623f5e41c635bfa9b82869157fb56d625c19c
Closes-bug:#1306005
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/32/86632/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: command => 'export OCF_ROOT="/usr/lib/ocf"; (ip netns list | grep haproxy) && ip netns exec haproxy /usr/lib/ocf/resource.d/mirantis/ns_haproxy reload', tries => 10, try_sleep => 10, require => [Service['haproxy'],Haproxy::Listen[$name], Haproxy::Balancermember[$name]],
deleted_lines: command => 'export OCF_ROOT="/usr/lib/ocf"; ip netns exec haproxy /usr/lib/ocf/resource.d/mirantis/ns_haproxy reload', tries => 3, try_sleep => 1, require => [Haproxy::Listen[$name], Haproxy::Balancermember[$name]],

commit_message:
Fix HA mode troubles with Sahara

* fix wrong Sahara public url in keystone endpoint-list
* add Sahara to Haproxy namespace

Closes bug #1305918

Change-Id: I00d2ccccc190a7ba1666b79880574fa56c31ec42

commit_message:
Obsolete Murano components removed

The following Murano components are no longer exist as separate objects:
* murano-conductor
* murano-repository
* murano-metadataclient

They were merged into murano-api according to the blueprint:
* https://blueprints.launchpad.net/murano/+spec/repository-reorganization

Closes-bug: 1306547

Change-Id: Ib45de78c00d680cb1cff4ff01c7c79de96e6d4f0

deleted_lines: desc 'Section/setting name to manage from conductor.conf'

commit_message:
Update neutron's selinux policies

Allow neutron permission to /mnt/state and /var/run.

Move directory creation from post-configure.d to configure.d.

Change-Id: Ia4ea5b84bbbe69b6d2e72a5b4d7a691d5213bdfa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/80/82980/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash set -eu [ -x /usr/sbin/semanage ] || exit 0 semanage fcontext -a -t neutron_var_lib_t "/mnt/state/var/lib/neutron(/.*)?" [ -d /mnt/state/var/lib/neutron ] || install -m 0755 -o neutron -g neutron -d /mnt/state/var/lib/neutron restorecon -Rv /mnt/state/var/lib/neutron semanage fcontext -a -t neutron_var_lib_t "/var/run/neutron(/.*)?" [ -d /var/run/neutron ] || install -m 0755 -o neutron -g neutron -d /var/run/neutron restorecon -Rv /var/run/neutron semanage fcontext -a -t neutron_log_t "/mnt/state/var/log/neutron(/.*)?" [ -d /mnt/state/var/log/neutron ] || install -m 0755 -o neutron -g neutron -d /mnt/state/var/log/neutron restorecon -Rv /mnt/state/var/log/neutron

commit_message:
Add docker support for nailgun::venv class

We don't need nailgun::database inside nailgun docker, so we
remove unneeded rquirements in manifests.

blueprint fuel-containerization-of-services

Change-Id: I863a69e41880b9ba5f55c0722ba46563eb690dd7

commit_message:
Use logdest syslog for puppet

Newer puppet 3.4.3 has working syslog
for puppet apply. Thus we can send messages
to syslog easily without usage of ImFile puppet
module.

Change-Id: Ibfdd4ab094fcf9586376a7f67369db65adc4006c
Closes-bug: #1304286
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute refs/changes/70/85970/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /usr/bin/puppet apply /etc/puppet/manifests/site.pp --logdest syslog "

commit_message:
Adds an Icehouse Preview appendix

- We may not want to include this in our version, but
something like this goes in O'Reilly's

Change-Id: Ia386f88c6ecc6c0a35d8ea8d2f151a8426e77aa7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/operations-guide refs/changes/76/86176/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <appendix xmlns="http://docbook.org/ns/docbook" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" version="5.0" xml:lang="en" xml:id="icehouse-preview"> <info> <title>Icehouse Preview</title> </info> <para>The Icehouse release of OpenStack was made available April 17, 2014, the day before this book went to print! Here is a preview of the features being offered for the first time for each project. Not all of these features are fully documented in the official documentation, but we wanted to share the list here.</para> <para>A few themes emerge as you investigate the various blueprints implemented and bugs fixed.</para> <itemizedlist> <listitem> <para>Projects now consider migration and upgrades as part of the "gated" test suite.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Projects do not have a common scheduler yet, but are testing and releasing various schedulers according to real-world uses.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Projects are enabling more notifications and custom logging.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Projects are adding in more location-awareness.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Projects are tightly integrating with advancements in orchestration.</para> </listitem> </itemizedlist> <para>These sections offer listings of features added, hand-picked from a total of nearly 350 blueprints implemented across ten projects in the integrated Icehouse release. For even more details about the Icehouse release including upgrade notes, refer to the release notes at <link xlink:href="https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ReleaseNotes/Icehouse" >https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ReleaseNotes/Icehouse</link>.</para> <section xml:id="blueprints_block_storage_cinder"> <title>Block Storage (cinder)</title> <para>31 blueprints</para> <itemizedlist> <listitem> <para>When using absolute limits command, let user know the currently used resources, similar to nova.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Notifications for volume attach and detach.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Resource management.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Deprecate the chance and simple schedulers.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Retyping volumes enabled - HP LeftHand, SolidFire.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Volume metadata stored on backup.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Let operators log the reasons that the cinder service was disabled.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Dell EqualLogic volumes can now be extended.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Support for qos_specs for SolidFire driver; creation and management of qos separate from volume-types.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Quota settings for deletion.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Backup recovery API for import and export.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Support for a request ID header to be returned in x-openstack-request-id metadata.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>EMC VNX Direct Driver added.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Fibre Channel Volume Driver added.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>HP MSA2040 driver added.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Enhancements to 3PAR driver such as migrate volume natively and the qos-specs feature.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>IBM SONAS and Storwize v7000 Unified Storage Systems drivers added.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>LeftHand driver enhancements.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>TSM Backup Driver enhancements.</para> </listitem> </itemizedlist> </section> <section xml:id="blueprints_common_oslo"> <title>Common (oslo)</title> <para>22 blueprints</para> <itemizedlist> <listitem> <para>Standalone rootwrap implementation.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Messages can be localized for i18n support.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Notifications are configurable.</para> </listitem> </itemizedlist> </section> <section xml:id="blueprints_compute_nova"> <title>Compute (nova)</title> <para>65 blueprints</para> <itemizedlist> <listitem> <para>Distinct policies for host aggregates.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Host isolation based on image properties (scheduled).</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>PCI Passthrough for Xen API driver.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Caching scheduler driver - experimental.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Utilization aware scheduler driver.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Compute node notifications.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Keypair notifications.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Instance groups in API.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Permanent compute node removal through the API.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Hypervisor IP Address through the API.</para> </listitem> </itemizedlist> </section> <section xml:id="blueprints_database_service_trove"> <title>Database Service (trove)</title> <para>23 blueprints</para> <itemizedlist> <listitem> <para>Integration with Orchestration.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Support for Apache Cassandra NoSQL database for Ubuntu.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Incremental backups for point in time restoration of database.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Limited support for MongoDB.</para> </listitem> </itemizedlist> </section> <section xml:id="blueprints_identity_keystone"> <title>Identity (keystone)</title> <para>26 blueprints</para> <itemizedlist> <listitem> <para>Users can update their own password.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>API v3 offers regions.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Default token download lasts 1 hour instead of 24 hours.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>The middleware for s3_token has moved to keystone client.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Trust notification for 3rd parties.</para> </listitem> </itemizedlist> </section> <section xml:id="blueprints_image_service_glance"> <title>Image Service (glance)</title> <para>10 blueprints</para> <itemizedlist> <listitem> <para>Can limit the number of additional image locations to pull from storage.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Upload an image policy now for v1 API.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>ISO Image support.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>NFS as a backend storage facility for images.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Image location support.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Image owners in v2 API.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Retry failed image download with Object Storage (swift) as backend.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Allow modified kernel arguments.</para> </listitem> </itemizedlist> </section> <section xml:id="blueprints_networking_neutron"> <title>Networking (neutron)</title> <para>43 blueprints</para> <itemizedlist> <listitem> <para>Migration paths for deprecated plugins.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Quotas extended to vips, pools, members, and health monitors.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Hyper-V agent security groups.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Least routers scheduler.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Operational status for floating IP addresses.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Open Daylight plugin.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Big Switch plugin enhancements - DHCP scheduler support.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>MidoNet plugin enhancement.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>One Convergence plugin.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Nuage plugin.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>IBM SDN-VE plugin.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Brocade mechanism driver for ML2.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Remote L2 gateway integration.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>LBaaS driver from Embrane, Radware.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>VPNaaS for Cisco products.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>NEC plugin enhanced to support packet filtering by Programmable Flow Controllers (PFC).</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Plumgrid plugin enables provider network extension.</para> </listitem> </itemizedlist> </section> <section xml:id="blueprints_object_storage_swift"> <title>Object Storage (swift)</title> <para>15 blueprints</para> <itemizedlist> <listitem> <para>Logging at the warning level for when an object is quarantined.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Better container synchronization support across multiple clusters while enabling a single endpoint.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>New gatekeeper middleware guarding the system metadata.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Discoverable capabilities added to /info API response so end user can be informed of cluster limits on names, metadata, and object’s size.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Account-level access control lists (ACLs) with x-Account-Access-Control header.</para> </listitem> </itemizedlist> </section> <section xml:id="blueprints_openstack_dashboard_horizon"> <title>OpenStack dashboard (horizon)</title> <para>40 blueprints</para> <itemizedlist> <listitem> <para>Live migration tasks can be performed in the dashboard.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Users can set public container access for Object Storage objects from the dashboard.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Users can create "directories" to organized their stored objects.</para> </listitem> </itemizedlist> </section> <section xml:id="blueprints_orchestration_heat"> <title>Orchestration (heat)</title> <para>53 blueprints</para> <itemizedlist> <listitem> <para>Adds Identity API v3 support.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Enables a Database as a Service resource.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Gives a stack filtering capability.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Provides a management API.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Provides a cloud-init resource for templates to use.</para> </listitem> </itemizedlist> </section> <section xml:id="blueprints_telemetry_ceilometer"> <title>Telemetry (ceilometer)</title> <para>21 blueprints</para> <itemizedlist> <listitem> <para>Alarms enabled for Hadoop through hbase.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Support for collecting metrics of VMS deployed on VMWare VCenter.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Exclude alarms on data points where not enough data is gathered to be significant.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Enable API access to sampled data sets.</para> </listitem> </itemizedlist> </section> </appendix>

commit_message:
Restart eth1 if we can't contact the geard broker

Fedora 20 instances sometimes fail to get an IP on the test network
Attempt to work around the problem by restarting the interface.

We have no guarantee that the address range of the test network wont
change at some stage so instead of testing for an IP existing on a
specific range we just test we can ping the geard broker.

I've also moved where we set PATH so that we can find the if* commands.

Change-Id: I57f3beab10021e87f169ca5c6efbd310c54bf730
Related-Bug: #1304085
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/10/86010/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The Fedora 20 instance sometimes fail to get an IP on the test network bug:1304085 # Attempt to work around the problem by restarting the interface. if ! ping -c 1 $GEARDSERVER ; then echo "Can't contact the geard host, assuming we didn't get an IP on the test network" sudo ifdown eth1 sudo ifup eth1 fi

commit_message:
NSX plugin: fix get_gateway_devices

Fixes the error and adds relevant unit tests.
Also fixes get_gateway_devices signature for allowing
paging and sorting.

Closes-Bug: 1306301

Change-Id: Icb52a764e111365beaf4dc4fb4a5b8970a6cf887

added_lines: def test_list_gateway_devices(self): with contextlib.nested( self._gateway_device(name='test-dev-1', connector_type='stt', connector_ip='1.1.1.1', client_certificate='xyz'), self._gateway_device(name='test-dev-2', connector_type='stt', connector_ip='2.2.2.2', client_certificate='qwe')) as (dev_1, dev_2): req = self.new_list_request(networkgw.GATEWAY_DEVICES) res = self.deserialize('json', req.get_response(self.ext_api)) devices = res[networkgw.GATEWAY_DEVICES.replace('-', '_')] self.assertEqual(len(devices), 2) dev_1 = devices[0] dev_2 = devices[1] self.assertEqual(dev_1['name'], 'test-dev-1') self.assertEqual(dev_2['name'], 'test-dev-2') get_gw_dev_statuses_patcher = mock.patch.object( l2gwlib, 'get_gateway_devices_status') get_gw_dev_statuses = get_gw_dev_statuses_patcher.start() get_gw_dev_statuses.return_value = {}

commit_message:
Remove unnessary logging conf files from Ironic elements

This patch removes unnessary logging conf files. These files are not
needed and are preventing logging from working correctly. By removing
these files the Ironic services will be better able to manage their
own logging.

Change-Id: I00b101157745387a921bd682266344b55d0558b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/39/86639/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: [loggers] keys = root [formatters] keys = normal_with_name, debug [handlers] keys = stdout [handler_stdout] class = StreamHandler level = WARN formatter = normal_with_name args = (sys.stdout,) [formatter_normal_with_name] format = (%(name)s): %(asctime)s %(levelname)s %(message)s [formatter_debug] format = (%(name)s): %(asctime)s %(levelname)s %(module)s %(funcName)s %(message)s [logger_root] level = WARN handlers = stdout

Remove unnecessary escape character in string format

When format string, " quoted in "" pairs should be escaped, but
it is unnecessary when quoted in '' pairs.

commit_message:
lb-agent: fix get_interfaces_on_bridge returning None

Change get_interfaces_on_bridge() to return [] instead of None
if the bridge is not found, as callers are expecting an iterator.

Change-Id: I359a2a0cf932c049f6891d4ba3eb8b9b23ab360d
Related-Bug: 1284311

commit_message:
Remove unused variable for UpdateReplace exception

Base class Exception have not attribute "_message" and variable
"message" has default value in init method, so attribute "_message"
could be removed.

Change-Id: I304e13d1923ef043f04f03477b94f88cea4bc52f

commit_message:
Remove mock.patch.stop from tests that inherit from BaseTestCase

The tests that inherit from BaseTestCase don't need to stop their
patches, since this is already done in the base class

Change-Id: Ibb1183e521686d6e948046997b32f4044d91d9e7
Closes-bug: #1305656

commit_message:
Stop neutron resource leaking even if an error occurs

In some test, if an error occurs in setUpClass(), some resources
are not deleted because of tearDownClass() is not called.
This commit fixes it.

 tempest/api
  +---- baremetal (unnecessary)
  +---- compute
  +---- data_processing (unnecessary)
  +---- database (unnecessary)
  +---- identity
  +---- image (done)
  +---- network         <-- this patch
  +---- object_storage
  +---- orchestration
  +---- queuing (unnecessary)
  +---- telemetry (unnecessary)
  +---- volume (done)

Partially Implements: blueprint stop-leaking

Change-Id: I580be8f974e3daa8ae4895ebb3e4311be8f9c242

commit_message:
Fixes Glance Registry V2 client

Add an optional configuration step to glance.db.get_api().

This step is then used in glance.db.registry.api in order to ensure that
the registry client has been configured in time for the registry db
driver's use.

Closes bug: #1302345

Change-Id: Id2c52c423b411ec20bdfa76ee91837c98b1613ef
Co-Authored-By: Mark J. Washenberger <mark.washenberger@markwash.net>
