commit_message:
Oslo-sync of latest version of apiclient.base

Synced patches:

273322a Revert "Revert "Removed set_loaded() method from Resource class""
04a1abe Revert "Removed set_loaded() method from Resource class"
41fbfea Add to_dict() method to apiclient Resource
0c4d2c7 Removed set_loaded() method from Resource class

Temporarily added method get() to Resource class. Method get() is
used only in novaclient tests and tempest tests, so it can be removed
after updating code in tempest

Change-Id: I882cbe6379511ffc3a0261f3a8b5ccf0891a25fb

commit_message:
Install guide edits for openSUSE/SLES

Some edits from testing the guide:
* Remove extra ntpd service setup, we have our own section for
  service ntp.

Change-Id: Ib82f7314e2831002c78e7a66eb59e752a09a71e4

commit_message:
Add a warning to not use get_table for working with ForeignKeys

The get_table utility loads a single table with a unique MetaData object
each time it's called but sqlalchemy needs the MetaData object to hold
information about both tables in the ForeignKey constraint so it
shouldn't be used when creating those types of constraints.  This patch
adds a warning to the method's docstring against it's usage in that
case.

Closes-Bug: #1303824

Change-Id: I7b038d668f08f166700300fd787a8cf3cab73a17
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/22/85722/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: warning:: Do not use this method when creating ForeignKeys in database migrations because sqlalchemy needs the same MetaData object to hold information about the parent table and the reference table in the ForeignKey. This method uses a unique MetaData object per table object so it won't work with ForeignKey creation.

because they are no longer supported

Add debian to cli install line

no mention of debian was given in the CLI install

However, it works fine with the ubuntu instructions,
so this patch adds it to the title for that section.

commit_message:
Fix conditional for debian/glance install

The Identity Service setup is handled by the debconf, and this
line was just orphan

In addition, a service restart is needed after the database changes.

Change-Id: I488a83460997393b065279dcd6ed27bcb76a3d96

commit_message:
Automatically parse YAQL-expressions during YAML parsing

Use matcher from yaql_expression module, thus making YAQL expressions
to be automatically detected and parsed during YAML parsing. This
allows to throw away several helper functions.

Also drop obsolete 'attributeNames' attribute handling.

The sample of new Dynamic UI version can be found at
http://paste.openstack.org/show/75428/

This commit should be reviewed in pair with
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/86376/

Change-Id: I08422a4c6a3e0dff4ad704d209cc27621c2a3c76
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard refs/changes/77/86377/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2014 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import re import types import yaql import yaql.exceptions class YaqlExpression(object): def __init__(self, expression): self._expression = str(expression) self._parsed_expression = yaql.parse(self._expression) def expression(self): return self._expression def __repr__(self): return 'YAQL(%s)' % self._expression def __str__(self): return self._expression @staticmethod def match(expr): if not isinstance(expr, types.StringTypes): return False if re.match('^[\s\w\d.:]*$', expr): return False try: yaql.parse(expr) return True except yaql.exceptions.YaqlGrammarException: return False except yaql.exceptions.YaqlLexicalException: return False def evaluate(self, data=None, context=None): return self._parsed_expression.evaluate(data=data, context=context)

sync oslo.db to bring in fixes to message handling

Handle exception messages with six.text_type tools instead of using
string.

the code is synced.

commit_message:
Partial fix of test_strutils.py on Python 3

StringToBytesTest does not work on Python 3 because it uses testscenarios which
does not work in nosetests, see the bug:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/testscenarios/+bug/872887

Because of this bug, the test_strutils.py is not enabled yet for py33 in
tox.ini.

Change-Id: Ie3a7742dfd802f21c6c7420e3b894122e1dca295

commit_message:
Parse YAML in muranoclient with the loader of the given class

This allows to embed YAQL-parsing inside the custom loader passed from
muranodashboard. By default yaml.Loader is used.

Change-Id: I2b0ef5949ce927a94806aa368674ae9fc3dbb677

commit_message:
Add test case for config generator hostname check

When I fixed the referenced bug I failed to add a unit test to
cover the error case, so it's been up to the reviewers to make sure
it doesn't regress.  Let's give the reviewers a break and add a
proper test case.

Related-Bug: #1205411

commit_message:
RabbitMQ 3 support

RabbitMQ 3 do not support such big TTL which we used before.
Big TTL was need to solve problem with node time dissynchronization.
Now we use NTP to resolve this issue. That is why this value
can be reduced.

Related-Bug: #1278336
Related-Bug: #1276770
Change-Id: I0a56b88247d9839bc3282294cdb8592ed2701c3a

commit_message:
Add warn Log in ComputeFilter if a service is disabld by hypervisor

Right now if the ComputeFilter encounters a disabled host,
it just logs it at debug level and skips it. If the host was automatically
disabled because of a connection fail, we should at least log that
as a warning in the scheduler
(like we do now for hosts that haven't checked in for a while)

Change-Id: I9748c2f95148e58072f6a2da3949f3520ce6095e
Partial-Bug: #1258625

deleted_lines: LOG.debug(_("%(host_state)s is disabled, reason: %(reason)s"), {'host_state': host_state, 'reason': service.get('disabled_reason')})

commit_message:
Delete node / delete environment should use env snapshot

It turned out there is no need to deploy simple environment
for delete xxx tests.

Change-Id: I518f861ffa8955bbe29013ca9313641a1f82fef3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/59/86859/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test(depends_on=[deploy_simple_flat], 1. Revert "simple flat" environment 2. Remove controller nodes 3. Deploy changes 4. Verify node returns to unallocated pull self.env.revert_snapshot("deploy_simple_flat") cluster_id = self.fuel_web.get_last_created_cluster() @test(depends_on=[SimpleFlat.deploy_simple_flat], groups=["delete_environment"]) 1. Revert "simple flat" environment self.env.revert_snapshot("deploy_simple_flat") cluster_id = self.fuel_web.get_last_created_cluster()
deleted_lines: @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_3], 1. Create cluster 2. Add 1 node with controller role 3. Add 1 node with compute role 4. Deploy the cluster 5. Validate cluster was set up correctly, there are no dead services, there are no errors in logs 6. Remove controller nodes 7. Deploy changes 8. Verify node returns to unallocated pull self.env.revert_snapshot("ready_with_3_slaves") cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, mode=DEPLOYMENT_MODE_SIMPLE ) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['compute'] } ) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.fuel_web.assert_cluster_ready( 'slave-01', smiles_count=6, networks_count=1, timeout=300) @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_3]) 1. Create cluster 2. Add 1 node with controller role 3. Add 1 node with compute role 4. Deploy the cluster self.env.revert_snapshot("ready_with_3_slaves") cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, mode=DEPLOYMENT_MODE_SIMPLE ) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['compute'] } ) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.fuel_web.assert_cluster_ready( 'slave-01', smiles_count=6, networks_count=1, timeout=300)

commit_message:
Update ha_delete_vips failover test

* It checks pacemaker VIP primitives at all controllers
* It looks for retored VIP at all controllers

Change-Id: I2e317a24bf46f908b084eb59fdf16eed9fe4f5b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/57/86857/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cluster_id = \ self.fuel_web.client.get_cluster_id(self.__class__.__name__) slaves = self.env.nodes().slaves[:3] for devops_node in slaves: # Verify VIPs are started. ret = self.fuel_web.get_pacemaker_status(devops_node.name) assert_true( re.search('vip__management_old\s+\(ocf::heartbeat:IPaddr2\):' '\s+Started node', ret), 'vip management started') assert_true( re.search('vip__public_old\s+\(ocf::heartbeat:IPaddr2\):' '\s+Started node', ret), 'vip public started') ip_assigned = lambda nodes: \ any([ip in self.fuel_web.ip_address_show( n.name, interface, '| grep ka$') for n in nodes]) wait(lambda: ip_assigned(slaves), timeout=10) assert_true(ip_assigned(slaves), 'Secondary IP is restored') # Run OSTF tests failed_test_name = ['Create volume and attach it to instance'] self.fuel_web.run_ostf( cluster_id=cluster_id, test_sets=['ha', 'smoke', 'sanity'], should_fail=1, failed_test_name=failed_test_name) # Revert initial state. VIP could be moved to other controller self.env.revert_snapshot("deploy_ha")
deleted_lines: # Verify VIPs are started. ret = self.fuel_web.get_pacemaker_status( self.env.nodes().slaves[0].name) assert_true( re.search('vip__management_old\s+\(ocf::heartbeat:IPaddr2\):' '\s+Started node', ret), 'vip management started') assert_true( re.search('vip__public_old\s+\(ocf::heartbeat:IPaddr2\):' '\s+Started node', ret), 'vip public started') for devops_node in self.env.nodes().slaves[:3]: ip_assigned = \ lambda: ip in self.fuel_web.ip_address_show( devops_node.name, interface, '| grep ka$') wait(ip_assigned, timeout=10) assert_true(ip_assigned(), 'Secondary IP is restored')

commit_message:
Sync latest oslo.db code

Common db code was updated in oslo. The most important thing is that
engine instances don't stored anymore in oslo.db - ce69e7f.
This patch moves methods `get_engine` and `get_session` to module
`heat.db.sqalchemy.api`.

Latest commit in oslo related to db module:
2fd457bf2ccbeb2b84ffb204778b6417cd5405ba

Change-Id: Iaa2e9ba26e824c678c698914170e3dffbf1c5c95
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/39/76539/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_session(): from heat.db.sqlalchemy import api as db_api return db_api.get_session()

subject: Use instance data instead of flavor in simple_tenant_usage extension
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-25 15:10:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/34dabb7ec80e2821d357876b8a6ce898a83123a5', 'message': 'Use instance data instead of flavor in simple_tenant_usage extension

The simple_tenant_usage extension gets the flavor data from the instance
and then looks up the flavor from the database to return usage information.
Since we now store all of the flavor data in the instance itself,
we should use that information instead of what the flavor currently
says is right. This both (a) makes it more accurate and (b)
avoids us failing to return usage info if a flavor disappears.

Change-Id: I1472d78e8e920013a1db5c76e04715fa04b696c2
Closes-Bug: #1276731

Since we now store all of the flavor data in the instance itself,
we should use that information instead of what the flavor currently

commit_message:
Use instance data instead of flavor in simple_tenant_usage extension

The simple_tenant_usage extension gets the flavor data from the instance
and then looks up the flavor from the database to return usage information.
Since we now store all of the flavor data in the instance itself,
we should use that information instead of what the flavor currently
says is right. This both (a) makes it more accurate and (b)
avoids us failing to return usage info if a flavor disappears.

Change-Id: I1472d78e8e920013a1db5c76e04715fa04b696c2
Closes-Bug: #1276731

commit_message:
Issue the volume detach request only once

Repeated calls for nova to detach a volume from a server can create a
race condition and leave the volume in wrong state (see bug 1238093).
This patch makes the volume detach call to nova only once to prevent
such problems.

Change-Id: If6f7403122486b9e0fd3d034102e2a6c31b7eee4
Related-Bug: #1298350

commit_message:
Add virtio-scsi bus support for bdm

Add support to use virtio-scsi controller when booting from a cinder
volume which is created from a glance image set with "virito-scsi"
hw_scsi_model property.

blueprint add-virtio-scsi-bus-for-bdm

Change-Id: I76a01d5cdb4e72d5121de0d821152102bc9d4fb2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/94/84494/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ===================================================== Add virtio-scsi bus support for block device mapping ===================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/add-virtio-scsi-bus-for-bdm VirtIO SCSI is a new para-virtualized SCSI controller device for KVM instances. It has been designed to replace virtio-blk, increase it's performance and improve scalability. Currently, using virtio-scsi bus is not supported when booting from volume. Problem description =================== VirtIO SCSI is a new para-virtualized SCSI controller device for KVM instances. It has been designed to replace virtio-blk, increase it's performance and improve scalability. The interface is capable of handling multiple block devices per virtual SCSI adapter, keeps the standard scsi device naming in the guests (e.x /dev/sda) and support SCSI devices passthrough. Currently, virtio-scsi bus has been supported when booting from glance image, which is implemented by BP ([1]) aimed to Icehouce. Howerver, take block-device-mapping into account, when booting from volume or attaching volume to instance, we can only use the libvirt's default "lsi" scsi controller by specifying "scsi" bus type. This BP aims to add virtio-scsi bus type support for block-device-mapping. The main use cases is to improve performance in I/O-intensive applications Proposed change =============== * Add a new "virtio-scsi" bus type to block-device-mapping-v2 extension * Libvirt driver will create the "virtio-scsi" controller when booting from volume with "virtio-scsi" bus type. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- There's no changes to the data model as a part of this effort. REST API impact --------------- * Specification: Create servers with block device mapping format (Changed): * Description: creates a server with a block device mapping. * Method type: POST * Normal http response code: 202 * Expected error http response code(s): same with the original API * URL: v2/{tenant_id}/servers * Parameters: same with the original API * Body data: similar to the original API, except: * Each dict item in "block_device_mapping_v2" list can use "virtio-scsi" as value of "bus_type" key * Response data: same with the original API * Policy changes: None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <zhangleiqiang@huawei.com> Work Items ---------- * Add a new "virtio-scsi" bus type to block-device-mapping-v2 extension * Libvirt driver will create the "virtio-scsi" controller when booting from volume with "virtio-scsi" bus type. Dependencies ============ * Depend on the BP [1], which will provide the virtio-scsi-controller object Testing ======= None Documentation Impact ==================== It will need to update the documentation for the API related to block-device-mapping-v2 extension. References ========== * [1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/libvirt-virtio-scsi-driver

commit_message:
Add exception handling in "nova diagnostics"

when using "nova diagnostics" with a not running
instance, user will get an incorrect message. This
change handles that exception.

Change-Id: Ia2aa76a5c2c2aeed446411700d74d547dd73cf90
Closes-bug: #1289079

commit_message:
Support RabbitMQ 3

For some strange reason EventMachine main thread process
publication message to 'Nailgun' exchange with terrible
delay. Update to new amqp gem (1.3.0) do not solve the
problem. It occurs only in the case of RabbitMQ 3.

Change-Id: I2fc1109bf19313784a72ceabde7da08d3397d2fc

commit_message:
Add auto_disabled column into service table

Bug 1250049 reported a problem with automatically disabling/enabling
a host via the libvirt driver, but rather than fix it the right way,
Add a new column to the Service table which indicates if an admin
intentionally disabled the host or if nova detected a fail and did
it automatically, a hack was done instead to prefix the 'disabled_reason'
with "AUTO:" and build some logic in the driver around that.

Partial-Bug: #1258625

Change-Id: I8e593136133228f5f48794f5c8f2039dfd1a53a0

commit_message:
only remove network states from Nova when n-net is enabled

When n-net is not enabled but q-dhcp is enabled then it's not
necessary to remove the states directory of nova-network.

Change-Id: Ib4b37aa7df2b3cda3048b278ddad24e87e3744c9

commit_message:
Add Neutron Metering Agent support

In Havana, Neutron has now a Metering Agent which gets meters from
virtual routers.

This patchs aims to allow devstack using this new service.

Change-Id: I17ad83799d60384247b98cc8a93ac032f641c721
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
(cherry picked from commit 40546f79e0e504d2d1470019a61a24da217e14fc)

commit_message:
Supports filtering port by address

This patch add support for getting a port by searching by its mac address
(/ports?address=<address>).

Change-Id: I6f501f52ad50e9d45e0c9637abf7451671d1b4ea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/73/82773/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from testtools.matchers import HasLength def test_port_by_address(self): address_template = "aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:f%d" for id_ in range(3): pdict = dbutils.get_test_port(id=id_, uuid=utils.generate_uuid(), address=address_template % id_) self.dbapi.create_port(pdict) target_address = address_template % 1 data = self.get_json('/ports?address=%s' % target_address) self.assertThat(data['ports'], HasLength(1)) self.assertEqual(target_address, data['ports'][0]['address']) def test_port_by_address_non_existent_address(self): pdict = dbutils.get_test_port() self.dbapi.create_port(pdict) # non-existent address data = self.get_json('/ports?address=%s' % 'aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff') self.assertThat(data['ports'], HasLength(0)) def test_port_by_address_invalid_address_format(self): pdict = dbutils.get_test_port() self.dbapi.create_port(pdict) invalid_address = 'invalid-mac-format' response = self.get_json('/ports?address=%s' % invalid_address, expect_errors=True) self.assertEqual(400, response.status_int) self.assertEqual('application/json', response.content_type) self.assertIn(invalid_address, response.json['error_message'])

Change-Id: Ia38d9bfcfe351ef96dc47180dc9e94ea2eef55e9

added_lines: """ Base classes for objects and collections """ import collectionsfrom itertools import ifilter from nailgun.db import NoCacheQuery """Base class for objects """ """Serializer class for object""" """SQLAlchemy model for object""" """JSON schema for object""" def check_field(cls, field): """Check if field is described in object's JSON schema :param field: name of the field as string :returns: None :raises: errors.InvalidField """ """Get instance by it's uid (PK in case of SQLAlchemy) :param uid: uid of object :returns: instance of an object (model) """ """Create object instance with specified parameters in DB :param data: dictionary of key-value pairs as object fields :returns: instance of an object (model) """ """Update existing instance with specified parameters :param instance: object (model) instance :param data: dictionary of key-value pairs as object fields :returns: instance of an object (model) """ """Delete object (model) instance :param instance: object (model) instance :returns: None """ """Serialize instance to Python dict :param instance: object (model) instance :param fields: exact fields to serialize :returns: serialized object (model) as dictionary """ """Serialize instance to JSON :param instance: object (model) instance :param fields: exact fields to serialize :returns: serialized object (model) as JSON string """ """Base class for object collections """ """Single object class""" @classmethod def _is_iterable(cls, obj): return isinstance( obj, collections.Iterable ) @classmethod def _is_query(cls, obj): return isinstance( obj, NoCacheQuery ) """Get all instances of this object (model) :param yield_per: SQLAlchemy's yield_per() clause :returns: iterable (SQLAlchemy query) """ def filter_by(cls, iterable, yield_per=100, **kwargs): """Filter given iterable by specified kwargs. In case if iterable=None filters all object instances :param iterable: iterable (SQLAlchemy query) :param yield_per: SQLAlchemy's yield_per() clause :returns: filtered iterable (SQLAlchemy query) """ map(cls.single.check_field, kwargs.iterkeys()) use_iterable = iterable or cls.all(yield_per=yield_per) if cls._is_query(use_iterable): return use_iterable.filter_by(**kwargs) elif cls._is_iterable(use_iterable): return ifilter( lambda i: all( (getattr(i, k) == v for k, v in kwargs.iteritems()) ), use_iterable ) else: raise TypeError("First argument should be iterable") def get_by_id_list(cls, iterable, uid_list, yield_per=100): """Filter given iterable by list of uids. In case if iterable=None filters all object instances :param iterable: iterable (SQLAlchemy query) :param uid_list: list of uids for objects :param yield_per: SQLAlchemy's yield_per() clause :returns: filtered iterable (SQLAlchemy query) """ use_iterable = iterable or cls.all(yield_per=yield_per) if cls._is_query(use_iterable): return use_iterable.filter(cls.single.model.id.in_(uid_list)) elif cls._is_iterable(use_iterable): return ifilter( lambda i: i.id in uid_list, use_iterable ) else: raise TypeError("First argument should be iterable") def eager(cls, iterable, fields, yield_per=100): """Eager load linked object instances (SQLAlchemy FKs). In case if iterable=None applies to all object instances :param iterable: iterable (SQLAlchemy query) :param fields: list of links (model FKs) to eagerload :param yield_per: SQLAlchemy's yield_per() clause :returns: iterable (SQLAlchemy query) """ use_iterable = iterable or cls.all(yield_per=yield_per) if fields: return use_iterable.options( return use_iterable def to_list(cls, iterable=None, fields=None, yield_per=100): """Serialize iterable to list of dicts In case if iterable=None serializes all object instances :param iterable: iterable (SQLAlchemy query) :param fields: exact fields to serialize :param yield_per: SQLAlchemy's yield_per() clause :returns: collection of objects as a list of dicts """ use_iterable = iterable or cls.all(yield_per=yield_per) use_iterable def to_json(cls, iterable=None, fields=None, yield_per=100): """Serialize iterable to JSON In case if iterable=None serializes all object instances :param iterable: iterable (SQLAlchemy query) :param fields: exact fields to serialize :param yield_per: SQLAlchemy's yield_per() clause :returns: collection of objects as a JSON string """ iterable=iterable """Create object instance with specified parameters in DB :param data: dictionary of key-value pairs as object fields :returns: instance of an object (model) """
deleted_lines: from nailgun.openstack.common.db import api as db_api _BACKEND_MAPPING = {'sqlalchemy': 'nailgun.db.sqlalchemy.api'} IMPL = db_api.DBAPI(backend_mapping=_BACKEND_MAPPING) def _check_field(cls, field): def filter_by(cls, query, yield_per=100, **kwargs): for k in kwargs.iterkeys(): if k not in cls.single.schema["properties"]: raise AttributeError( u"'{0}' object has no parameter '{1}'".format( cls.single.__name__, k ) ) use_query = query or cls.all(yield_per=yield_per) return use_query.filter_by(**kwargs) def get_by_id_list(cls, query, id_list, yield_per=100): use_query = query or cls.all(yield_per=yield_per) return use_query.filter(cls.single.model.id.in_(id_list)) def eager(cls, query, fields, yield_per=100): use_query = query or cls.all(yield_per=yield_per) if fields: return use_query.options( return use_query def to_list(cls, query=None, fields=None, yield_per=100): use_query = query or cls.all(yield_per=yield_per) use_query def to_json(cls, query=None, fields=None, yield_per=100): query=query

The Client() class should pass in insecure as the value of
CONF.identity.disable_ssl_certificate_validation, otherwise many

Closes-Bug: 1298019
'}]
commit_message:
Cinder client does not honor disable_ssl_certificate_validation

The Client() class should pass in insecure as the value of
CONF.identity.disable_ssl_certificate_validation, otherwise many
tests will fail if the cinder server is secured with SSL.

Change-Id: I9bb6ff48a0d53b5b124e58c9959c9a43da8c7e5c
Closes-Bug: 1298019
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/84/83184/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: dscv = CONF.identity.disable_ssl_certificate_validation insecure=dscv,

commit_message:
Add mission statement to Cinder

At the TC meeting on 2014-03-25 we did a gap
analysis on the Cinder project and identified that
Cinder still doesn't have an official mission statement.

This change adds the Cinder mission statement and matches
that which is included on the Cinder Wiki page.

Change-Id: I38753f778663bbd22418581ab752efc6f90da29d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/28/84528/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mission: To implement services and libraries to provide on-demand, self-service access to Block Storage resources within OpenStack. Provides Software Defined Block Storage via abstraction and automation on top of various block storage devices.

Add assertion to ensure the file extension

This patch adds an assertion in the process of
checking templates to be sure a good file extension
is used.

commit_message:
Make tests use Node object instead of dict

A number of tests were passing dicts to methods instead of the Node
object. This fixes the tests and some various places in code were doing
node.get() instead of just accessing the Node object attribute directly.

Change-Id: I6d39c861fe771714bdac3b85cbb798f27850565d

added_lines: # This is a dictionary of my_version:child_version mappings so that # we can support backleveling our contents based on the version # requested of the list object. child_versions = {} def obj_make_compatible(self, primitive, target_version): primitives = primitive['objects'] child_target_version = self.child_versions.get(target_version, '1.0') for index, item in enumerate(self.objects): self.objects[index].obj_make_compatible( primitives[index]['nova_object.data'], child_target_version) primitives[index]['nova_object.version'] = child_target_version def obj_what_changed(self): changes = set(self._changed_fields) for child in self.objects: if child.obj_what_changed(): changes.add('objects') return changes

commit_message:
Add a whitelist mechanism for drivers

Before Ironic would try to load all the drivers by default, but some
drivers might require libraries that are not part of the requirements.txt
(e.g third-party libraries) and these libraries may also not be present on
the system when the ironic-conductor starts causing things to fail. So
this patch adds a drivers_whitelist option that prevent the drivers
that are not listed to not load. Drivers that depends on external libraries
in trunk should not be listed there by default.

Each driver name in the list is interpreted by Ironic as a pattern that
could contain shell-style wildcards, for e.g: One that wants to enable
all fake drivers could add "fake*" to the list.

Closes-Bug: #1302562
Change-Id: I1749854f91273dbb606adce1de66b886019abe8b

commit_message:
Cleanup running conductor services in tests

The conductor manager tests are not stopping services that are
started, instead relying strickly on database cleanup.  This is
causing condcutor periodic tasks to bleed into other test cases
and cause occasional unrelated deadlocks in logging later on during
test runs.

Change-Id: I7502df5dec7c42fe1a20bebad8f9ad393572d17d
Closes-bug: #1300420

commit_message:
Revise register_cli_opts implemention mistake

In register_cli_opts method, the code
for opt in opts:
     self.register_cli_opts(opt, group)
should be:
for opt in opts:
     self.register_cli_opt(opt, group)

Change-Id: Idc2895806879c36b545c4ab7afaf6a964673cde7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/64/83964/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fuelclient major refactoring

 * package structure
 * some implementation ideas
 * a lot of working functions
 * fixed Fuelclient tests
 * fixed action validation
 * fixed formatting and pep8
 * fixed copyright
 * fixed unnecessary request during deployment

 Implements: blueprint fuelclient-refactoring

Change-Id: Ice7f96273afb5d96e7970acfc45c61bab620aaed

commit_message:
attach/detach interface should raise exception when instance is locked

when instance is locked, exception should be raised if attach and
detach an interface operation is performed. This patch add instance
lock check for the 2 APIs, catch and process the exception at API layer.

Change-Id: I6c0b05dafb9d480c8f0002bcc8306cb65a32aaf7
Closes-Bug: #1275741
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/26/71526/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @check_instance_lock @check_instance_lock

commit_message:
Check image exists before calling inject_data

os.stat removal is needed for network-based image backends

Partly revert Change-Id: I264540de736c2bcb92567826fe5ba672e1244ba2
Partly fixes bug #1257674

commit_message:
Ensure 'latest' is replaced to 'installed' for OS packages

That change is needed for patching OS feature.
Versions given in versions.yaml will be used instead.

Partial blueprint: patch-openstack

Change-Id: Ia647af1b6b54bc5c90da1c6ebb5b674610fb4bce
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Add ability to run nailgun tests in parallel on ci

TEST_NAILGUN_DB=nailgun_gw0 nosetests nailgun/test

nosetests uses entry_points, so it requires to run command:

python setup.py develop

Change-Id: Ie5a24d970f73ef35b1c4e61bbc4b2a738d96b34f
Closes-Bug: #1282565

added_lines: # Copyright 2014 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os from nailgun.settings import settings def pytest_configure(config): if hasattr(config, 'slaveinput'): slaveid = config.slaveinput['slaveid'] db_name = '{0}_{1}'.format(settings.DATABASE['name'], slaveid) os.environ['PGUSER'] = settings.DATABASE['user'] os.environ['PGHOST'] = settings.DATABASE['host'] os.environ['PGPASSWORD'] = settings.DATABASE['passwd'] if not_present(db_name): os.system("psql -c 'create database {0}'".format(db_name)) settings.DATABASE['name'] = db_name def not_present(name): return os.system("psql -l | grep -o '^ {0}'".format(name))

commit_message:
Add test cases for validate_extra_spec_keys

There is no unit test cases for function flavors.validate_extra_spec_keys,
this patch adds for it

Change-Id: I689aad1ce7428687c723ecd2eba243fccb3342bf
Closes-Bug: #1292316
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/84/83284/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2014 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Tests for flavor basic functions""" from nova.compute import flavors from nova import exception from nova import test class ExtraSpecTestCase(test.NoDBTestCase): def setUp(self): super(ExtraSpecTestCase, self).setUp() def test_flavor_validate_extra_spec_keys_invalid_input(self): key_name_list = ['',] self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidInput, flavors.validate_extra_spec_keys, key_name_list) key_name_list = ['*',] self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidInput, flavors.validate_extra_spec_keys, key_name_list) key_name_list = ['+',] self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidInput, flavors.validate_extra_spec_keys, key_name_list) def test_flavor_validate_extra_spec_keys(self): key_name_list = ['abc', 'ab c', 'a-b-c', 'a_b-c', 'a:bc'] flavors.validate_extra_spec_keys(key_name_list)

commit_message:
compute: using format_message() to convert exception to string

We probably need to use format_message when converting a
NovaException to a string.
As well we can remove the cast to unicode of the parameter msg
from the local method notify since this method will only get
message in a string format.

Change-Id: I6fddfb9e124b4096f0ebc3da81c3044b1b24cedf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/18/73218/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: notify("error", msg=e.format_message()) # notify that build failed notify("end", msg=e.format_message()) # notify that build is done
deleted_lines: notify("error", msg=unicode(e)) # notify that build failed notify("end", msg=unicode(e)) # notify that build is done

subject: Avoid the possibility of truncating disk info file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-09 14:36:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a15dfa085576d56958cda1efe45e55d669261b8c', 'message': 'Avoid the possibility of truncating disk info file

Patch I2016efdb3f49a44ec4d677ac596eacc97871f30a makes nova persist
image format to a file to avoid attacks based on changing it later.
However the way it was implemented leaves a small window of opportunity
for the file to be truncated before it gets written back to effectively
making it possible for data to get lost leaving us potentially with the
same problem.

This patch changes the way file is updated to be atomic, thus closing
the race window (and also removes the chown that we did not really
need).

It is worth noting that the a better  solution to this would be
to allow the code calling the imagebackend to write the file (once!)
and make it impossible to update after the boot process is done. This
approach would require more refactoring of the libvirt driver code, and
may be done in the future.

Change-Id: Ia1b073f38e096989f34d1774a12a1b4151773fc7

commit_message:
Avoid the possibility of truncating disk info file

Commit dc8de42 makes nova persist image format to a file to avoid
attacks based on changing it later. However the way it was implemented
leaves a small window of opportunity for the file to be truncated before
it gets written back to effectively making it possible for data to get
lost leaving us with a potential problem next time it is attempted to be
read.

This patch changes the way file is updated to be atomic, thus closing
the race window (and also removes the chown that we did not really
need).

It is worth noting that a better solution to this would be
to allow the code calling the imagebackend to write the file (once!)
and make it impossible to update after the boot process is done. This
approach would require more refactoring of the libvirt driver code, and
may be done in the future.

Partial-bug: #1221190
Change-Id: Ia1b073f38e096989f34d1774a12a1b4151773fc7

deleted_lines: fd = os.open(self.disk_info_path, os.O_RDWR | os.O_CREAT, 0o644) with os.fdopen(fd, "r+") as disk_info_file: if self.path in dct: msg = _("Attempted overwrite of an existing value.") raise exception.InvalidDiskInfo(reason=msg) dct.update({self.path: driver_format}) disk_info_file.seek(0) disk_info_file.truncate() disk_info_file.write('%s\n' % jsonutils.dumps(dct)) # Ensure the file is always owned by the nova user so qemu can't # write it. utils.chown(self.disk_info_path, owner_uid=os.getuid())

commit_message:
RabbitMQ 3 support

RabbitMQ 3 do not support such big TTL which we used before.
Big TTL was need to solve problem with node time dissynchronization.
Now we use NTP to resolve this issue. That is why this value
can be reduced.

Related-Bug: #1278336
Related-Bug: #1276770
Change-Id: Iee79f14929e9f1ac5e5e7dd07aee37f641d3b2a8

commit_message:
Relocate haproxy and VIPs to the network namespace

Includes:
* OCF script for managing VIP inside network namespace
* OCF script for managing haproxy inside network namespace
* changes in manifests

blueprint relocate-haproxy-to-its-own-network-namespace

Change-Id: I11a77920a0f0cf3827e52630f95f23e2eb4a965b

Remove rendundant parentheses of cfg help strings

There is a hacking review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/74493/.
That makes me be aware we maybe have rendunant parentheses.
We'd better clean the parentheses, Python will handle that well.

commit_message:
Add 'Tested platforms' section in README.md

This section gives some information to developers
about what distributions and releases should work
for running devtest.

Closes-Bug: 1296576
Change-Id: I54cda76fe1a3a154554660cba617bf948db3d3f4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/01/84801/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Supported platforms ------------------- devtest is not known to work in Ubuntu 12.04. While the code tries its best to work with Ubuntu 12.04, we encourage users to use the latest Ubuntu release available.

commit_message:
Add scsi-target-utils to cinder node install

Without this package, tgtadmin is not available, so the guide
does not work. Tested under fedora 20.

Change-Id: I826c4a776330a030e09d90cb7304619df130b4fd

commit_message:
improve description of resource

* improve the name of resource, "rally-instance-xxx" instead of "xxx"
* add description of some resource, such as volumes and tenants, which
  helpful for dashborad users
* remove redundant codes and adjust unit tests

Change-Id: Ia92f0cbc59bb94183082d64fca3e3b4204ef5b26

commit_message:
Add test case for tenant usage API

Tempest have so many test including negative test.
But, it is not enough in some part. That should be complemented.
This patch will add some negative tests for tenant usage API.

Change-Id: I93058a9436eedf70b0a3d221ef29796c745900cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/18/83318/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_list_usage_all_tenants_with_invalid_date(self): # Get usage for all tenants with invalid date params = {'start': self.end, 'end': self.start, 'detailed': int(bool(True))} self.assertRaises(exceptions.BadRequest, self.adm_client.list_tenant_usages, params) @test.attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_list_usage_all_tenants_without_params(self): # Get usage for all tenants without parameters self.assertRaises(exceptions.BadRequest, self.adm_client.list_tenant_usages, '')

commit_message:
skip selenium tests, when WITH_SELENIUM is not set

It was possible, a selenium test case was called,
even if it wasn't specified.
Closes-bug: #1241027

Change-Id: Id2547191d534efe4c26dd7439dff59fa773255eb

subject: Make base.CrudManager._put() use _update() method.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-03 12:54:07.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient/commit/fc9a462610d188f0c762ddff54d7a15d9c31cc7a', 'message': 'Make base.CrudManager._put() use _update() method.

In order to avoid confusion when calling CrudManager._put()

commit_message:
Make base.CrudManager._put() use _update() method.

In order to avoid confusion when calling CrudManager._put()
method a CrudManager._update() method is now used in order to
make a clear statement that there is no different use between
the two methods.
In case url argument in _put() is None, CrudManager.build_url()
will be called.

Change-Id: Idfe384686729ad9be005abf57ddfce2caec81575
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/23/85023/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _put(self, url, body=None, response_key=None, **kwargs): if url is None: url = self.build_url(dict_args_in_out=kwargs) return self._update(url, body=body, response_key=response_key, method='PUT')
deleted_lines: def _put(self, url, body=None, response_key=None): resp, body = self.client.put(url, body=body) # PUT requests may not return a body if body is not None: if response_key is not None: return self.resource_class(self, body[response_key]) else: return self.resource_class(self, body)

commit_message:
make LaunchInstance Workflow fullscreen, wizard and responsive

set fullscreen and wizard to True in create_instance's workflow
change step template to use row-fluid/span instead of table
change css to make better use of space

Implements bp Modals and supporting different screen sizes
Change-Id: I716a8a9fa5f0424c6b7cd2e4edcd59c9b586f10f

If you create a stack passing a non-ascii string as a value of one
of the parameters, all subsequent stack-list/stack-show calls will
fail with UnicodeDecodeError. All string parameters should be
treated like unicode strings within heat-api/heat-engine processes
and converted from/to bytes only when passed via network.

Related-Bug: #1249234

Change-Id: I0f0f9008401b3a6ebdb2c41905a9a578dfb1aae8
'}]
commit_message:
Fix listing of stacks with non-ascii parameters

If you create a stack passing a non-ascii string as a value of one
of the parameters, all subsequent stack-list/stack-show calls will
fail with UnicodeDecodeError. All string parameters should be
treated like unicode strings within heat-api/heat-engine processes
and converted from/to bytes only when passed via network.

Related-Bug: #1249234

Change-Id: I0f0f9008401b3a6ebdb2c41905a9a578dfb1aae8

commit_message:
Test for neutron api with provider extension

Add test for list, show , create, and update network
with provider extension for local and vlan network type.

Change-Id: I7c60408baeb84a6e7a979fb002fd0c95d2d90481
Co-authored-by: chenZheng <czheng@cn.ibm.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/64/79864/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cls.admin_networks = [] @classmethod def tearDownClass(cls): # Clean up networks try: for network in cls.admin_networks: try: cls.admin_client.delete_network(network['id']) except exceptions.NotFound: pass finally: super(BaseAdminNetworkTest, cls).tearDownClass() @classmethod def create_network_with_provider_attributes(cls, network_name=None, network_type=None, physical_network=None, segmentation_id=None): """Wrapper utilitty that creates a test network. :param network_name: The name to give the created network. :param network_type: The network type to use. Defaults to the Tempest config for provider_network_type. :param physical_network: The physical network to use. :param segmentation_id: The segmentation id to use for the physical network. """ network_name = network_name or data_utils.rand_name('test-network-') network_type = network_type or cls.config.network.provider_network_type physical_network = physical_network or ( cls.config.network.provider_physical_network) segmentation_id = segmentation_id or ( cls.config.network.provider_segmentation_id) resp, body = cls.admin_client.create_network( name=network_name, network_type=network_type, physical_network=physical_network, segmentation_id=segmentation_id) network = body['network'] cls.admin_networks.append(network) return network

subject: add notification alarm
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-27 21:32:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/cf744ae707f6f8a8eb9e4302078bd2f2282c0889', 'message': 'add notification alarm

allow alarms to be created based on a notification type or a
payload of a notification. For example: you can create an
alarm using the following command:

  ceilometer alarm-notification-create
      --name network-alarm
      --notification-type "network.*"
      -q "network.name=example;age<5"

this will create an alarm, when a notification type matches
network.* and the payload of the notification with network.name
equals word "example", and the age less than 5, an alarm will
be triggered.

Change-Id: I3493ad23640e9ecac40b5c6a8b6cfb1eedb8b7ab
bp: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/alarm-on-notification

'}, {'number': 15, 'created': '2014-02-18 15:29:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/03d0e2d9c7f07646c98076b48e0aa91965375900', 'message': 'add notification alarm

allow alarms to be created based on a notification type or a
payload of a notification. For example: you can create an
alarm using the following command:

ceilometer alarm-notification-create
    --name network-alarm
    --notification-type "network.*"
    --period 1000
    -q "network.name=example;age<5"

this will create an alarm, when a notification type matches
network.* and the payload of the notification with network.name
equals word "example", and the age less than 5, an alarm will
be triggered. The period parameter indicates that the alarm state
will be set back to OK when time elapsed 1000 seconds or more
since the trigger time.

Change-Id: I3493ad23640e9ecac40b5c6a8b6cfb1eedb8b7ab
bp: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/alarm-on-notification

allow alarms to be created based on a notification type or a
payload of a notification. For example: you can create an
alarm using an API like this:

POST /v2/alarms
{
        "alarm_actions" : [ ],
        "description" : "whatever desc.*",
        "enabled" : true,
        "name" : "site-alarm",
        "ok_actions" : [ ],
        "project_id" : "196d33a3d0e24752b86a66e6948c9c84",
        "repeat_actions" : false,
        "notification_rule" : {
                "notification_type" : "site.*",
                "query" : [
                        {
                                "field" : "network.name",
                                "type" : "",
                                "value" : "examle",
                                "op" : "eq"
                        },
                        {
                                "field" : "age",
                                "type" : "",
                                "value" : "5",
                                "op" : "lt"
                        }
                ],
                "comparison_operator" : "eq",
                "period" : 1000
        },
        "state" : "insufficient data",
        "type" : "notification",
        "user_id" : "4a1beba01f6c4b10a2b0664f966435be"
}

this will create an alarm, when a notification type matches
site.* and the payload of the notification with network.name
equals word "example", and the age less than 5, an alarm will
be triggered. The period parameter indicates that the alarm state
will be set back to OK when time elapsed 1000 seconds or more
since the trigger time.

Change-Id: I3493ad23640e9ecac40b5c6a8b6cfb1eedb8b7ab
bp: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/alarm-on-notification

commit_message:
add notification alarm

allow alarms to be created based on a notification type or a
payload of a notification. For example: you can create an
alarm using an API like this:

POST /v2/alarms
{
  "alarm_actions" : [ ],
  "description" : "whatever desc.*",
  "enabled" : true,
  "name" : "site-alarm",
  "ok_actions" : [ ],
  "project_id" : "196d33a3d0e24752b86a66e6948c9c84",
  "repeat_actions" : false,
  "notification_rule" : {
    "notification_type" : "site.*",
    "query" : [
      {
        "field" : "network.name", "type" : "",
        "value" : "examle", "op" : "eq"
      },
      {
        "field" : "age", "type" : "",
        "value" : "5", "op" : "lt"
      }
    ],
    "comparison_operator" : "eq",
    "period" : 1000
  },
  "state" : "insufficient data",
  "type" : "notification",
  "user_id" : "4a1beba01f6c4b10a2b0664f966435be"
}

this will create an alarm, when a notification type matches
site.* and the payload of the notification with network.name
equals word "example", and the age less than 5, an alarm will
be triggered. The period parameter indicates that the alarm state
will be set back to OK when time elapsed 1000 seconds or more
since the trigger time.

Change-Id: I3493ad23640e9ecac40b5c6a8b6cfb1eedb8b7ab
bp: alarm-on-notification

commit_message:
Display more specific error on image creation

When the creation of an image, whose size exceeds the limit set in quota,
is attempted, the error message displayed to the user is just a generic one.
Display a more detailed error message in this case.

Change-Id: Ib65b8966bc0c14708519cfb43991bf8643374225
Closes-Bug: #1270817

deleted_lines: except Exception: exceptions.handle(request, _('Unable to create new image.'))

commit_message:
Adds job filtering support to jobboards

Specify a topic when creating a job, then use the
topic kwarg of JobBoard.iterjobs to filter. A glob
can be specified when filtering.

Change-Id: Id0ed5e611c0c550873c24ecdbee9466c14a0574d
Implements: blueprint job-filtering

commit_message:
Read-Only Middleware

What does 'read-only' mean ?
With read-only filter in the pipeline, only GET and HEAD requests are
allowed to pass through.

Functionality
This simple filter has two 'modes' of operation where in it can:
* Make the entire cluster/deployment as read-only.
* Make only selected accounts as read-only.

Caveats
* Accounts to be made read-only are listed in conf file.
* The read-only functionality is not user-specific like ACLs.

This change attempts to implement something similar to what
is descibed in the following blueprints:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/read-only-middleware
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/read-only-objects

Change-Id: If7fef080e36e5f6e3c34e032edc9d6148e3e86c2
Signed-off-by: Prashanth Pai <ppai@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/87/83687/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
quota-delete changed to delete the quota for a specific resource

The quota-delete method receives a new optional parameter with the
resource to be deleted. This operation when receives a resource, resets
the quota to the default just for this specific resource.

This new parameter could go in both cases of quota-delete: with tenant
or with tenant and user.

This commit depends on the implementation done in nova with change:
I645b19203956a0ae79db6581b8615fc6c123fe6f

Change-Id: Ie05125329c9e84c5f441c3bd7301d1d9e908e108
Partial-Bug: #1064854

added_lines: def test_quotas_delete_with_resource(self): tenant_id = 'test' resource = 'fake_resource' self.cs.quotas.delete(tenant_id, resource=resource) url = '/os-quota-sets/%(tenant_id)s?resource=%(resource)s' params = {'tenant_id': tenant_id, 'resource': resource} self.cs.assert_called('DELETE', url % params) def test_user_quotas_delete_with_resource(self): tenant_id = 'test' user_id = 'fake_user' resource = 'instances' self.cs.quotas.delete(tenant_id, user_id=user_id, resource=resource) url = '/os-quota-sets/%(tenant_id)s?user_id=%(user_id)s&' \ 'resource=%(resource)s' params = {'tenant_id': tenant_id, 'user_id': user_id, 'resource': resource} self.cs.assert_called('DELETE', url % params)

commit_message:
VMware: fix rescue with disks are not hot-addable

Some disks, for example IDE, cannot be attached to an instance
when the instance is running.

Closes-Bug: #1247556
(cherry picked from commit 8797aeaf14352a353ebfd1ed011f63a5b2fa3447)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: I3360066ea6406564caa328ec052b9e3ca9d63dc6

subject: NSX: Fix status sync with correct mappings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-27 02:20:07.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/nicira/common/sync.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/nicira/test_nvp_sync.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/d81ba30be801e53973184fc923f590c148716a3b', 'message': 'NSX: Fix status sync with correct mappings

The code that syncs router status to the neutron_db was using the nsx
router id instead of the neutron router id thus synchronize_router
would never update the database.

Also, the switch synchronization routine was not fetching the
appropriate neutron id tag thus causing switch synchronization to
be skipped.

This patch also fixes the error in the unit tests which allowed for
the bug to be introduced.

Co-Authored-By: Salvatore Orlando <salv.orlando@gmail.com>
Closes-bug: 1283856

Conflicts:

	neutron/plugins/nicira/common/sync.py

Change-Id: I26342ecea6ad546b224b7fca1e55f754b4883363
(cherry picked from commit ec3dfc93da605b7c41682951f2fd1e27fb09d53b)

commit_message:
NSX: Fix status sync with correct mappings

The code that syncs router status to the neutron_db was using the nsx
router id instead of the neutron router id thus synchronize_router
would never update the database.

Also, the switch synchronization routine was not fetching the
appropriate neutron id tag thus causing switch synchronization to
be skipped.

This patch also fixes the error in the unit tests which allowed for
the bug to be introduced.

Co-Authored-By: Salvatore Orlando <salv.orlando@gmail.com>
Closes-bug: 1283856

Conflicts:

	neutron/plugins/nicira/common/sync.py

Change-Id: I26342ecea6ad546b224b7fca1e55f754b4883363
(cherry picked from commit ec3dfc93da605b7c41682951f2fd1e27fb09d53b)

commit_message:
Use unminified javascript files

In Debian, minified javascript are considered either as an
obfuscation of the original code, or as a "compiled-in binary"
version of them, and therefore minified javascript files are
considered non-free.

Moreover, the use of unminified javascript will ease the
development on client side. There will be no impact on Horizon
performance due to the compress tag of Django.

This is a backport of: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/67096/

Change-Id: Iadc1bd0bfad09eb418601134180eb8cc74671022
Closes-Bug: #1269727
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/98/82298/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix evaluation_periods usage in DB2 engine

This bug was fixed on master along with a major refactoring of the
db2 storage engine that unified the mongo and db2 code as much as
possible. This refactoring was not merged back to stable/havana
but the bug exists there as well.

This patches fixes the evaluation_periods field name in the rule
encapsulation code. As tests existed for the mongo engine these
tests are now moved to a common place and extended to run on both
db2 and mongo engines.

The test uncovered another small difference between the two engines.
Db2 does not add type field for the query during the encapsulation.
This difference is resolved in the same way as on the master branch
by adding the type field also in db2.

Closes-Bug: #1281181
Change-Id: Ib6894c774ec3fe322a2b8a75cc036cedcee5ce43

commit_message:
Add --dhcp-ip option to dhcp-agent-network-add

A part of blueprint enable-to-set-dhcp-port-attributes

The blueprint provides "add network to dhcp agent" API to enable to
specify DHCP port attributes. This patch is counterpart of CLI.

--dhcp-ip option is added to dhcp-agent-network-add to enable to
specify ip address[es] of the dhcp port. Other attributes of dhcp_port
can be specified by using 'values_specs'.

Usage:
neutron dhcp-agent-network-add --dhcp-ip ip_address=IP_ADDR dhcp_agent network
  --dhcp-ip ip_address=IP_ADDR
                Desired IP for dhcp port:
                subnet_id=<name_or_id>,ip_address=<ip>, (This option
                can be repeated.)
DocImpact

Change-Id: I71204987e01529734301d2437743deae3b868957

args.extend(options) args.extend([agent_id, net_id]) if values_specs: args.extend(values_specs) body = {'network_id': net_id} if extra_body: body.update(extra_body) self.mox.StubOutWithMock(cmd, "get_client") self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.client.httpclient, "request") cmd.get_client().MultipleTimes().AndReturn(self.client) self.client.format = self.format path = (self.client.agent_path + body=test_cli20.MyComparator(body, self.client), headers=mox.ContainsKeyValue( 'X-Auth-Token', test_cli20.TOKEN)).AndReturn( (test_cli20.MyResp(201), resstr)) self.mox.ReplayAll() cmd_parser = cmd.get_parser('add_network_to_dhcp_agent') shell.run_command(cmd, cmd_parser, args) self.mox.VerifyAll() self.mox.UnsetStubs() _str = self.fake_stdout.make_string() self.assertTrue("Added network %s" % net_id in _str) def test_dhcp_agent_network_add(self): self._test_dhcp_agent_network_add() def test_dhcp_agent_network_add_with_dhcp_port(self): options = ['--dhcp-ip', 'ip_address=10.0.0.10'] added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # # (c) Copyright 2013 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # @author: Swaminathan Vasudevan, Hewlett-Packard. # import logging import os from neutronclient.common import exceptions from neutronclient.neutron import v2_0 as neutronv20 from neutronclient.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ class ListVPNCredential(neutronv20.ListCommand): """List VPNCredentials that belong to a given tenant.""" resource = 'vpn_credential' log = logging.getLogger(__name__ + '.ListVPNCredential') list_columns = ['id', 'name', 'server_key'] pagination_support = True sorting_support = True class ShowVPNCredential(neutronv20.ShowCommand): """Show information of a given VPNCredential.""" resource = 'vpn_credential' log = logging.getLogger(__name__ + '.ShowVPNCredential') class CreateVPNCredential(neutronv20.CreateCommand): """Create an VPNCredential.""" resource = 'vpn_credential' log = logging.getLogger(__name__ + '.CreateVPNCredential') def add_known_arguments(self, parser): parser.add_argument( '--name', help=_('Set friendly name for the connection')) parser.add_argument( '--ca', metavar='CA', required=True, help=_('PEM encoded CA Certificate file')) parser.add_argument( '--server_certificate', metavar='SERVER_CERTIFICATE', required=True, help=_('PEM encoded Server certificate')) parser.add_argument( '--server_key', metavar='SERVER_KEY', required=True, help=_('PEM encoded Server key')) parser.add_argument( '--dh', metavar='DH', required=True, help=_('PEM encoded DH key')) parser.add_argument( '--crl', metavar='CRL', help=_('PEM encoded CRL Key')) def _read_file(self, file_name): try: with open(os.path.expanduser(file_name)) as f: body = f.read() return body except IOError as e: raise exceptions.CommandError( "Can't open or read '%s': %s" % (file_name, e)) def args2body(self, parsed_args): _ca = self._read_file(parsed_args.ca) _server_certificate = self._read_file(parsed_args.server_certificate) _server_key = self._read_file(parsed_args.server_key) body = {'vpn_credential': { 'ca': _ca, 'server_certificate': _server_certificate, 'server_key': _server_key, }, } if parsed_args.name: body['vpn_credential'].update( {'name': parsed_args.name}) if parsed_args.tenant_id: body['vpn_credential'].update( {'tenant_id': parsed_args.tenant_id}) if parsed_args.dh: _dh = self._read_file(parsed_args.dh) body['vpn_credential'].update( {'dh': _dh}) if parsed_args.crl: _crl = self._read_file(parsed_args.crl) body['vpn_credential'].update( {'crl': _crl}) return body class UpdateVPNCredential(neutronv20.UpdateCommand): """Update a given VPNCredential.""" resource = 'vpn_credential' log = logging.getLogger(__name__ + '.UpdateVPNCredential') class DeleteVPNCredential(neutronv20.DeleteCommand): """Delete a given VPNCredential.""" resource = 'vpn_credential' log = logging.getLogger(__name__ + '.DeleteVPNCredential')

commit_message:
Add CLI support for service-context to insert service instance

CLI changes to support service-context which is provided as an
attribute during service creation. The service-context is specified
as key:value pairs where the value is a list of resources of the type
indicated by the key. router, network, subnet & port are supported.

Change-Id: I8b80c88b0ce0930b866796c49b87853b0a021afe
Implements: blueprint fwaas-service-insertion-cli

added_lines: # Copyright 2014 Openstack Foundation. # All Rights Reserved # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # @author: Sridar Kandaswamy, Cisco Systems Inc. # # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 from neutronclient.common import exceptions from neutronclient.neutron import v2_0 as neutronv20 def sc_str2dict(scstr): """Make a dict from the str with the different options and corresponding resource lists. Checks are made for invalid or duplicate options. """ valid_sc_options = ['routers', 'subnets', 'ports', 'networks'] _info = {} for kv_str in scstr.split(","): k, v = kv_str.split("=", 1) if k not in valid_sc_options: message = _( "Service context KeyError: " "Reason-Invalid key : " "'%(key)s' not in %(supported_key)s ") % { 'key': k, 'supported_key': valid_sc_options} raise exceptions.CommandError(message) if k not in _info: _info.update({k: v.split()}) else: message = _( "Service context KeyError: " "Reason-Duplicate key: ") raise exceptions.CommandError(message) return _info def sc_validate_resources(sc_dict, client): """Validates the resources provided in each of the lists.""" attr_to_resource = {'routers': 'router', 'networks': 'network', 'subnets': 'subnet', 'ports': 'port'} for key in sc_dict: for val in sc_dict[key]: neutronv20.find_resourceid_by_name_or_id( client, attr_to_resource[key], val)

commit_message:
Facilitate debugging unit tests in Eclipse

Add a comment and code to facilitate debugging unit tests in Eclipse.
Developers can manually comment/uncomment this line as needed in their
environment.

Change-Id: I57ea2640e0afec91f75f4664719ffbcc974333f5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/65/75465/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # In order to debug unit tests in Eclipse, you need to call monkey_patch with # thread=False #eventlet.monkey_patch(thread=False)

commit_message:
Raise max header size to accommodate large tokens

The max header is exceeded in the following scenario
- Auth tokens built with a keystone v3 API catalog
- A catalog with approximately 8 or more endpoints defined

Remove this config item because new configuration parameters should not be
introduced in stable backports.

Change-Id: Ie815e457c0b25ab828e780b5d90233ba0ceff61f
Closes-Bug: #1251026
(cherry picked from commit b22442a6b80c22f6e31d086263cdb77de10d92ef)

subject: Do not prompt error when create user with default role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-20 13:01:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/91c3bf33f840245d5662642f8c57b95d351fe65b', 'message': 'Do not prompt error when create user with default role

When keystone is set to assign new user with default role, and
create user with the default role in Horizon, it prompt error
because keystone return Conflict exception with code of 409. This
exception should result an error to user, because the new user is
actually created successfully with the expected role.

Closes-Bug: #1260439

Change-Id: Id0914da9b8855bdf2b1afe11e1e870250f1a9c70
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-24 07:28:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/1491631737c1d6b1ed0dbe644c8a11f7da0f150b', 'message': 'Do not prompt error when create user with default role

When keystone is set to assign new user with default role, and
create user with the default role in Horizon, it prompt error
because keystone return Conflict exception with code of 409. This
exception should result an error to user, because the new user is
actually created successfully with the expected role.

Since keystone does not provide api to get default role, and the
api.keystone.get_default_role method use different config file
with keystone to define the default role var, there is no way to
get default role from keystone. This error have to be ignored to
avoid confusing users.

Closes-Bug: #1260439

Change-Id: Id0914da9b8855bdf2b1afe11e1e870250f1a9c70
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-13 14:36:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/dc3a7c4b0dbe76e6137845bdcd054ee884e16f85', 'message': 'Do not prompt error when create user with default role

create user with the default role in Horizon, it prompt error

exception should result an error to user, because the new user is
actually created successfully with the expected role.

Closes-Bug: #1260439

Change-Id: Id0914da9b8855bdf2b1afe11e1e870250f1a9c70
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-24 06:18:17.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/users/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/users/forms.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/f3276b71ae1b20242d8ace39917c099ce7ed543c', 'message': 'Do not prompt error when create user with default role

'}]
commit_message:
Do not prompt error when create user with default role

Do not assign default role again after create a new user

commit_message:
Release candidate updates for Networking chapter

As part of the installation guide improvement project, I performed
the following operations on the Networking chapter:

1) Moved Neutron ML2 sections before OVS sections and updated
   associated notes to steer users toward ML2.
2) Removed database population steps because Neutron populates the
   database at first run.
3) Moved 'enable_security_group' key to [securitygroup] section.
4) Removed extraneous colons from procedure titles.
5) Added command output to Neutron initial networks section.
6) Added command output to Nova initial networks section.

Change-Id: Ie677d199d2c64ef2a564eaa551295e1a321db02c
Partial-Bug: #1291071
Implements: blueprint networking-install-guide-improvements

added_lines: Cluster Validation ------------------For Vanilla Hadoop version 1.X.X: + Cluster must contain exactly one namenode + Cluster can contain at most one jobtracker + Cluster can contain at most one oozie and this process is also required for EDP + Cluster can't contain oozie without jobtraker + Cluster can't have tasktracker nodes if it doesn't have jobtracker For Vanilla Hadoop version 2.X.X: + Cluster must contain exactly one namenode + Cluster can contain at most one resourcemanager + Cluster can contain at most one historyserver + Cluster can contain at most one oozie and this process is also required for EDP + Cluster can't contain oozie without resourcemanager and without historyserver + Cluster can't have nodemanager nodes if it doesn't have resourcemanager
deleted_lines: Limitations -----------* Cluster should contain * exactly one namenode * at most one jobtracker * at most one oozie * Cluster cannot be created if it contains worker processes without containing corresponding master processes. E.g. it cannot contain tasktracker if there is no jobtracker

commit_message:
Add network parameters to Heat template creation.

In order to allow the allocation of a floating IP in the heat
template, we need to give network paremeters as input.

This patch :
- updates the heat template to associate a floating IP to the
created server
- Use python-neutronclient to find the needed network id to pass to
the heat template

Fixes bug 1301324

Change-Id: If6182d1bf6196022b77bfaf26d2563a483f1a460

commit_message:
Removes direct access of timeutils.override_time

The attribute "override_time" is a private attribute which
should only be set through "timeutils.set_time_override()".
There are a number of places in Ceilometer which the override_time
attribute is set directly and such behavior should be prohibited.

However the "set_time_override()" function along with "override_time"
in timeutils is planned to be removed, therefore we no longer
need to use it.

Change-Id: I6f3a5e0bb4e4c448f369dd5ead0e1525fd2262e6
Related-Bug: #1266962

commit_message:
driver.create/remove_export() require elevated context

The volume manager should call driver.create_export()
and driver.remove_export() with an elevated context.

This is already done for remove_export() in some cases
but not in initialize_connection error paths, or for
terminate_connection.

This will at a minimum cause issues with the LVM LIO
driver as its create/remove_export methods uses database
queries requiring admin access (volume_get_iscsi_target_num,
iscsi_target_count_by_host).

Partial-Bug: #1300148
Closes-Bug: #1305197

Change-Id: I5c1091cf9720ebccefc328b64fbf2982b3aac397
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/00/86400/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Expounded on global environments.

Explained that the effective environment used for a stack is the
combination of the user-supplied environment and the provider-supplied
"global" environment.

Change-Id: I0e005dad6efb80a76ecff6337454e2e891e692ca
Partial-Bug: #1297060
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/31/84331/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --------------------------------- Global and effective environments --------------------------------- The environment used for a stack is the combination of (1) the environment given by the user with the template for the stack and (2) a global environment that is determined by the cloud provider. Combination is asymmetric: an entry in the first environment takes precedence over an entry in the second. The OpenStack software includes a default global environment, which supplies some resource types that are included in the standard documentation. The cloud provider can add additional environment entries. The cloud provider can add to the global environment in two ways. One is by putting environment files in a configurable directory wherever the heat engine runs. The configuration variable is named "environment_dir" and is found in the "heat.common.config" module (AKA the "[DEFAULT]" section) of "/etc/heat/heat.conf". The default for that directory is "/etc/heat/environment.d". Its contents are combined in whatever order the shell delivers them when the heat engine starts up, which is the time when these files are read. The other way for a provider to extend the global environment is through heat engine plugins that define "available_resource" and/or "constraint" mappings. If the "my_env.yaml" file from the example above had been put in the "environment_dir" then the user's command line could be this:

commit_message:
Bump pep8, pyflakes and flake8 versions

Since newer versions of each package can either break
hacking(flake8, pep8) or introduce new rules and because we gate on
the output of hacking, we pin these dependencies to specific versions.

* Set pyflakes to the newest version: 0.8.1
* Set flake8 to to the newest version: 2.1.0
* Set pep8 to 1.4.6, since newer version (1.5.1) breaks hacking and will
  require additional work to support it. Will be addressed in a future
  patch.

Add the new versions along side the old versions so we don't create a
backwards incompatible global requirements change.

To support hacking change: Ia3495102a9d096c09802b9c079a8dc7ec1f65530

Change-Id: I5bebee5af87a75781b840daead61436af0d6ab3a

commit_message:
fixes broken neutron-netns-cleanup

Some configuration parameters used in neutron.agent.linux.utils
were missing. The namespace attribute in the FakeNetwork object
was missing, and used in neutron.agent.linux.dhcp. Also, the
plugin object was missing for release_dhcp_port operation.

We provide a fake plugin object to accept current and any future
plugin calls as this is meant to be an standalone tool that
should work without any RPC connectivity.

FakeNetwork was switched for neutron.agent.linux.dhcp.NetModel
to follow any future changes in NetModel.

Two wrong called_once_with_args calls without assert were fixed.

Change-Id: Ia51ea9bd4c8eea6b250858964ad5286c933702e0
Closes-Bug: #1291915
Partial-Bug: #1297875

commit_message:
netns-cleanup: kill metadata proxy server

When cleaning up netns, stop metadata proxies properly which was spawned
by l3-agent.

Fixes: bug #1115999
Signed-off-by: Isaku Yamahata <yamahata@valinux.co.jp>
Change-Id: I70635e6508e581781d88fab691b0cd50a30c4779

commit_message:
Revert "add mirror requirements list"

This reverts commit b1101620fc0ba1938708b2e93f529341a016f0ae.

The new thinking is that hacking itself should enforce that the
three hacking requirements are not in project's test requirements.

Change-Id: I7167968c272552838985fe8b9241549abae0da18

commit_message:
Updated Launch chapter

As part of the installation guide improvement project, I performed
the following operations on the Launch chapter:

1) Split monolithic file with instructions for nova networking into
   separate files for nova and neutron networking.
2) Updated instructions in each section to account for differences
   between nova and neutron networking.
3) Updated other sections and glossary as necessary.

Change-Id: I7faaadc0787cf85d816c7c2aab1247ecc77195b2
Partial-Bug: #1291071
Implements: blueprint networking-install-guide-improvements

commit_message:
Add EPEL-7 repo for RHEL7

* RHEL7 requires epel for many dependencies.
* The default RDO URL also switched to an icehouse version.
* RHEL6 RDO repo also will be configured for RHEL7, but the
  configuration variable name remains RHEL6_RDO_REPO_RPM for compatibility
  reasons.

Change-Id: I414c0f5357bf24c8d5657ea8231515461862e734
